text:
I had heard good things about Brickhouse. My friend and went there on a Monday for dinner. It was pretty quiet.

We sat in a booth on the main level. Never again! The booth backs are loose, so every time the guy behind me leaned back, I got pushed forward. When he returned to the table after stepping away for a few minutes, he hit the back of the seat pretty hard and I got slammed forward. (I'm not blaming the guy here, the restaurant needs to fix these booths!)

The server didn't tell us that there were drink specials, until he brought them and let me know that my beer was on special. That would have been nice to know ahead of time though. It might have affected my friend's order. The waiter informed my friend that they were out of the beer she ordered (a hefeweizen) and suggested another one that he said was similar. What he brought was not a wheat beer at all, very hoppy and bitter. My beer tasted like garlic, as if they had made a Bloody Mary in the glass, rinsed it with water, and poured my beer. Pretty gross!

Also, there were a ton of gnats/fruit flies flying around, which was distracting and kind of nasty.

The meat on the pulled pork sandwich was good, but I wish their sauces tasted better. Fries were ok. My friend got a tiny bowl of beef chili, which she said was ok, but pretty brothy for chili. Overall, I thought the food was unimpressive, but not bad.

This BBQ place is really fun and has a great atmosphere. It is casual and has a great variety of different sauces and great mac and cheese! The ribs were not as good as I expected, but the food here is definitely worth trying! I love the pulled pork quesadillas! Try them!

Love cannot even begin to describe what I feel for Brickhouse Barbecue. It's my favorite spot on campus for lunch, dinner, or a beer (they have over 40 on tap!) on the outdoor patio. The brisket sandwich is divine - tender steak topped with melted cheese and onion strings on a perfectly toasted bun. The sandwiches come with fries that are out of this world... they have some sort of batter that makes them extra crunchy. Dipping everything in Brickhouse's trio of homemade BBQ sauces takes the whole meal to the next level.  And did I mention the mac and cheese side dish? Cork screw noodles smothered in a cheddar cheese sauce and tossed with toasted panko bread crumbs. The portions are huge, the prices are low, and the food is scrumptious. It's a win all around.

I have been here multiple times before and thought it was pretty good. Over time I have noticed a slight slip in quality of the food. This last trip for lunch sealed the deal for me and I will not be back. The first floor was about 1/3 full so it was not too crowded. We were a party of 4. Two ordered burgers and two ordered ribs. One ordered an appetizer that came with the meal instead of before the meal. The worst part was that it took 50 minutes to get our food and once it arrived for two of the people, it took 5 more minutes for the other 2 to get their food. The burgers were tasty as was the cornbread. The ribs were way overcooked and dry and had a slightly burnt taste. My guess is that they were cooked significantly earlier and then reheated on a grill. My collard greens were tough and too salty to eat. Not once during our wait did anyone come by and let us know that the kitchen was behind. No one ever asked how our food was after the wait. There are significantly better places to get BBQ than here.

Sides are the best!

The entrees and sandwiches can be hit or miss though.

A great atmosphere, beer list and really fun I'm the summer

First off, read this with the understanding that it is a very new place and may not have hit its stride yet...

My brother and I are both native Texans.  We are very open minded about different types of BBQ and understand that there are a million variations of it...and we love them all!  LOL  

The above being said, the food served at Brickhouse can in no way be construde as BBQ.  My brother had the "so called" brisket sandwich which should be appropriately renamed as a roast beef sandwich...if that is actual brisket, they need serious lessons.  It was flavorless and dried out from being reheated improperly.

I had a sausage combo that claimed to be both cajun sausage and smoked sausage but they both looked and tasted identical and neither tasted great.  The sauces served along with the meals are good.  The sides are interesting and actually more flavorful than the main courses.  The one thing that I had that knocked my socks off was the lemon icebox pie...it was frozen solid and hard to cut but it tasted great.

As other reviewers have pointed out the atmosphere, selection, and service were are all very good.  There is a rooftop bar that hasn't opened yet but it looks like it might be a great hang.

Perhaps they should just tweak the name to "Brickhouse"?  Then people like me will relax about the BBQ thing.  LOL  After all, it is a beautiful place.
Always nice drinks and good food.  Pleasant staff as well.   If you're looking for something exotic,  don't come here.  It's a bbq place, so be expecting that.  They do a good job of it.

I can't give a rave review with the limited amount of info that we have, but, so far, this place is pretty much batting 1000 for us. Consequently, I won't take off any stars either.   Happened to feel the urge as we drove past at about 4 PM, so we stopped in.  No problems parking out front at that hour.  Place was almost empty, which suited us just fine.

Then I discovered that they have about 30 different beers on tap.  If you can't find something on their list, you probably don't like beer very much.

Tried the appetizer sampler, with ribs, duck drumsticks, Buffalo Wings, and onion rings.  Everything on that sampler was quite good to better than that.  They seem to know how to do bbq ribs  per wife, who is our expert.  Their selection of sauces is also just about  right, hitting the vinegar based, brown sugar based, and more spicy  types very nicely.

This joint is definitely good enough for a retest when we have the chance.

I came here for a pre-party during Great Taste of the Midwest 2012. Therefore, I cannot really comment on the food, as I was only here to drink. Their tap selection was awesome - they were hosting 3 fantastic out of town breweries. The space was gorgeous - loved the different levels and the view of the Capitol was breathtaking. I would definitely return for some grub!

The chicken wings were just blah. I got the original bbq and I swear there wasn't even any sauce on them. Dry. My fries tasted like the sweet potato fries they were probably cooked right next to. All that and delivery takes over an hour and they 4$. Not really worth it; maybe the restaurant experience is better.

Service was fine. My catfish sandwich was fine, I sure didn't taste anything spicy on it. The beer selection was well above average. The highlight for me was the chili. Very hearty and very meaty...real chunks of beef. None of that ground beef gunk.

Went here for lunch (on a Saturday) and was pleasantly surprised as soon as we walked in.  From the outside the place looks, well, not like a great BBQ would look like.  Maybe it just looks too new.  The inside however was very appealing.  Very clean with a brick wall and nice wood work.  As soon as you walk in, you can see lot's and lot's of interesting beers on tap (they have 20-30 on tap).  My group was already ordering before I got halfway through the tap list.  I "settled" on a fat tire as to not hold up the works.  The other folks tried a variety of local beers and they all reported favorably.
I had the chicken wings and found them delicious.  They were very smokey and the sauce didn't overwhelm  Al the other folks got pulled pork sandwiches and all enjoyed them. I wish I had more time/meals here in town to try more of their food and beer.
Service was really bad.  Completely under staffed. Out of pulled pork. What type of BBQ joint sells out of pulled pork?  And the food we did have was cold. Won't be going back.

HORRIBLE!   Came in for a quick lunch and ordered ribs. Stopped in once before and the Manager/Waiter was very pleasant and the ribs were good and also had an hour long very pleasant conversation in getting to know each other well. This time the ribs were fatty with little meat with the second visit and dry and cold food which I strongly feel it was done on purpose. To top it off the bartender was very mean from the first moment I sat down. Immediately he told me that he would be with me later in which I then asked for a menu since my parking meter was running short. He never offered me any utensils nor water. Was extremely unpleasant from the very beginning giving me the impression that I was intruding on his time. I asked to pay for my meal right away. Never thought about the strange encounter and the bartenders rudeness until he started yelling at me in front of other patrons at the bar and in the restaurant. . While I was reading my iPhone the whole time while waiting for my food to be delivered and to be eaten at the bar and I never realized that I was lacking in a good service but was being totally ignored instead.  Also I did not even notice how he never greeted me at the bar nor made any recommendations  towards my lunch selections.  Also I did not realize how fast and pushy he was asking for my order while he was at the cash register. Again no good service. Never smiled nor was pleasant in any way towards me, the customer. Very impersonal.  Later I was quite surprised to see a young woman bring my food 'out to go' in which my reply to her was that I never ordered my food 'to go'. The Waiter appearing visibly upset and snatched the bag of food out of her hand and rushed the food to,the kitchen while I'm hearing him in the kitchen complaining about me to the kitchen staff while I'm sitting at the bar with other patrons.
When the food was returned on a plate the food was then cold , the ribs were poor in quality of meat and extremely fatty. 75% fat and 25% meat  along with very dry and cold macaroni and cheese. The sweet potatoes were also cold. I then asked to be served a glass of water and utensils so I can eat the food. I got a good impression that he only wants to wait on his regular customers and friends. He made it very clear from the moment I sat down that he did not want to wait on me when I interrupted him while he was filling a glass of water for another.

I was going to let this all go by 'the wayside' until when my food was sitting on the bar cold and I had no water nor utensils. I then asked for utensils and water to drink while eating my cold dry and fatty food. It was at this time a younger customer who apparently is a friend of his sat next to me at the bar. He had no idea what transpired beforehand.  It was at this time this young male made a very negative statement aimed at me without having a clue what transpired beforehand since he was not present. I could not believe my ears and I asked him to repeat himself. I was right. He was being negatively intrusive which was none of his business. My response was that he did not know up to this point just what had transpired and that he should not intervene since he had no clue what just happened.  I told him that he now just started a bigger mess and that he should have stayed out of it

It gets better!
The bartender comes back to the bar and literally starts screaming at me telling me that he wants to kick me out of the restaurant. When I asked to speak to the manager and hoping it was the rational pleasant Manager I had an hour talk with last time I stopped in and he is originally from Appleton, I was then surprised to see another Manager in his place

This gets better!
When I asked the bartender to have the Manager come out per my request I heard the bartender literally screaming in the kitchen about the scenario with me who,is the  customer, who wants to eat at the bar and not food to go. I knew I was being set up since everyone there seems to be friends and little consideration favored upon the customers

The Manager came out to talk to me and was very biased. It was apparent that he was taking the side of his friend/bartender since He just heard his loud angry one sided statement.  I held my ground and told the shortened version of the facts since I was not being allowed to speak to explain in length.  At the same time while I was trying to RATIONALLY explain my side of the events the bartender was literally screaming at me the whole time for everyone in the restaurant to hear.  I even pointed out that he can exhibit so much anger at the customer, so how can he be employed as a bartender in the service industry?  He even lied in his version of events to try to sway his customers and staff.   And he was constantly interrupting me when I was talking

This is the ultimate #1 worst dining experience and #1 worst quality of food that I've tasted in my 60 yrs of eating. I do not recommend this place .

I was excited to try Brickhouse Barbeque for the first time tonight! My partner and I arrived at 6:30 pm and were greeted by the hostess who told us that we would have a 30 minute wait. We were just glad to have the night off of work and so we didn't mind waiting at the bar and ordering drinks. It took the bartender 10 minutes to even say hello to us even though there were only 4 other patrons at the bar. My partner and I decided to be positive about the situation and go ahead and order two beers and two shots of patron. Shortly after we enjoyed our drinks we were told that our table was ready. When we sat down the waitress came over and greeted us but then went away for 15 minutes!!!!! She even took the order of the table next to us before ours and they were seated well after us. When she finally returned we ordered and then waited for the food to arrive. When the food came out it was cold and almost seemed like it wasn't fresh! My partner ordered the brickhouse mac and cheese and I had the pulled pork. The mac and cheese was TERRIBLE! It was cold, stale tasting AND it had no cheese on it! Our server came back 10 minutes later after we had been well into the meal and we explained how sad we were with the quality of the food. We were offered another meal but by this time we had been there for 2 hours and were simply annoyed. We were never offered to speak to management and in fact we seemed to be rushed out of the place. I have NEVER had such horrible service and food in Madison, Wisconsin. I think a meal from McDonalds would have been a more satisfying choice! After our dinner we decided to go to Dotty Dumplings Dowry where we were treated with respect and greeted from the moment we walked in until the time we left. 

Shame on you Brickhouse.

Beer selection was great. Sauces are refrigerated all the time. Use them with your meat and they instantly chill whatever you're eating with it. Sauces could use some refining as there isn't any a traditional sauce as a choice. The Hawaiian Pork and And brisket were more flaked then pulled. Dry more than juicy.  Have to say the best thing this menu has to offer is the beer. The Monday night bartender is overwhelmed with service at the bar as well as serving the group in the loft. He can't multi task and at one point disappeared with quite some time to step out and smoke a cig for about 10 minutes.

Yuck. We were here in March and it was fabulous. Tonight it was just terrible. Fatty brisket. Cold food. Took 45 minutes to get and it was awful. Bathroom was not clean. Table was not wiped down. Not going back.

Gretchen was our waitress and she did a great job for a Packer fan. :-) This place was very nice and the food was great. I had the brisket sandwich with mac and cheese and it was excellent. They give you a lot of food so expect to be fl when you leave. The beer selection was great.

First time there and it was well worth the trip. The brisket and Mac and cheese was great. Ordered the Hawaiian pork was not what I had expected. It was a little to spicy for my liking. Overall great BBQ spot in Madison and the pour on the bourbon was very generous. Definitely got three fingers worth. Will be back soon.

Better than anticipated!  We came with a Groupon and I can't  wait to come back.  We started with the nachos with pulled pork and I was completely impressed.  The sauces were awesome and the atmosphere was chill.  We will be back!!!

They said they would let a party of 15 eat on the rooftop. We arrive and they say they can't accommodate and put us in the back. They then end up putting us at two separate tables and bring food at two different times. We then had to ask for one of our entrees as they completely forgot one persons order. We go and talk to the manager and he has a huge attitude and is completely rude. Ok food and will never end up here again based on run around and service. This place is not worth coming too.

Been here a couple times, and the one thing I can say is that it's consistently inconsistent.  Had rented a room here one time and the food and service were awesome, room was great and we've always talked about doing it again.

This evening though, not so much.  Beer and bourbon list is great, no doubt about that. Food was ok.  One of my biggest issues when going out to dinner is when my food comes out within 10 minutes of ordering.  I'm there to hang out a bit, have a drink, not to start eating after my first sip.  BBQ is cooked ahead, I get that as well.  If you are going to bring it out that quick, at least make sure it's hot!

All that aside, the food was good.  Had the brisket and pulled pork, green beans and sweet potato salad.  Pork/brisket were great and the sauces were awesome. Carolina sauce is something I'd love for home and the mustard is great as well.  Would get the beans again...and again..and you get it.  

We will definitely go again, not doubt about it.  May just try something they cook to order.

Went with my main thot. We each got the brisket entree. The sides were pretty good, but the meat was lackluster at best. Sorta dry and flavorless on its own. Nothing like the south. Very very good sauces though, they saved the day. I very much liked the aesthetic of the place. The service was quite good, the waitress was super chill with us being clouded.

Everything was great except for the main thing.
I like this place. The brick house burger is really good, the service is good as well. I like  its corn bread very much although it's just a side dish
Waited 43 minutes for food. Was not busy when we walked in. No apologies. Others were served ahead of us. Many choices nearby. Choose wisely.

Stopped at brickhouse while visiting Madison for the first time. There was a great selection of Wisconsin beers on tap. We ordered the catfish sandwhich which was delicious and also tried the pulled pork sandwich which was great too. Our server was friendly and helpful. Very pleased and would definitely recommend!

Brickhouse Barbeque is one of my favorite restaurants to go to in Madison.  I always start out with their nachos topped with tender beef brisket, they are to die for.  I also always get their turkey blt, the avocado and roasted tomatoes really take a basic sandwich and make it fabulous. You are always greeted by a friendly staff and a warm environment.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

The service was slow as the hostess didn't seem to do anything and couldn't even take the money for the bill.  Had to wait around for the bartender.

I had a full rack of ribs and mac and cheese.  My wife had the Mac combo of ribs, pulled pork and brisket.  Quite honestly, my mac and cheese was cold and had maybe a teaspoon of the baked on crust praised on the menu.  The ribs were good but certainly not the best I've had.  My apples were mush and the cornbread stale and hard.  I sate the ribs and left the rest.  My wife was disappointed with the brisket and pulled pork and didn't eat the apples or the cornbread.

After complaining to the waiter, he took her drink off of the bill!#$%. And although the atmosphere is nice, I don't think that we will go back there again.  Certainly not on her birthday!
Great beer selection and the food is very good. The outdoor patio is a great addition to Madison this summer.

I very, very rarely write in to Yelp, but I feel like I need to be the tie-breaker on this one, as the reviews are wildly divergent.

There are two possibilities for this place.  Either

a) it entirely depends on when you are here

or

b) people don't know what good BBQ is here in Madison.

Now, I live in NYC now, so I'm a bit food-spoiled.  But I love BBQ, so my standards are pretty low.

This was not good BBQ.  I had the full ribs, with mac & cheese, succotash.  Sides were alright, nothing to write home about.  The ribs were overcooked and dried out, and were intolerable on their own.  Sure, if you slather them in enough BBQ sauce, they taste alright, but so does cardboard.

Don't go.  Overly expensive (at least by Madison standards) and just flat out not good BBQ.

Good $5 prices on quite a few taps, good service and no tax on the beers which for this Minnesotan was a nice surprise, an even $10 check.  Food looked and smelled good, but we didn't have anything, people around us had quick service.  My girlfriend liked the colorful globes above the bar.

Nothing to write home about, but still the nicest place for a student to take their parents if they live in the high-rises across the street and don't want to walk more than 2 minutes in 15 degree weather.

The menu features classic BBQ choices such as pulled pork, brisket, ribs, and burgers. They recently added to their menu so those seasoned patrons can mix it up a little.  Portions are good and while prices are a little high, everything seems to be cooked fresh.

Try the mac and cheese as a side, especially delicious and one of the best mac's I've ever had. Also they have 40 beers on tap and a whole menu page dedicated to brandy, whiskey, and bourbon.

As for the service: it sucks. Plain and simple. They quote wait times for tables at 20 minutes than end up being closer to 45. Once you are seated it takes another 10 minutes to place a drink order, and food sometimes takes upwards of 45 minutes from order until it's at your table. If it's a weekend and you have plans even 3 hours from when you get there to eat plan to get to your destination quickly, as you're going to cut it close.

Three strikes and your out! I gave this place three chances! Each time the food was horrible and I let the waiter know. No one cared or did anything. I am SURE that this food is microwaved and then served to you! It tasted old and dry! I ordered BBQ platter and everytime the meat tasted like it was sitting there all day. Sweet potato salad is served cold which is fine but why are the potatoes hard as rocks??? I asked the server and he said that is just how they do it! Seriously? Well tell people who order it, because that's not normal and I would have appreciated knowing that info! The waiter said everyone complaines about that side dish for the same reasons! WOW! The only nice thing I can say is that the building is beautiful, and there seems to be a ton of space. How this place has stayed in business for a year is mind blowing!   Double Gross is what I give this restaurant!

I went with 3 coworkers over lunch today. It was the slowest service ever. Maybe it was just our waiter, though, because the table next to us arrived after us, ate, and left before us. 
All 3 of us agreed that the food was just OK. The "spiced apples" were essentially chopped, crunchy apples mixed in a spiced apple sauce.

I've eaten quite a bit of BBQ, and this was a disappointment.  The brisket was tough, to say the least.  The staff was friendly, and our waiter was quite funny.  At the same time, the beer selection was impressive.  However, the food itself was seriously lacking.

I would recommend it as a place to stop in and have one of their many beers - but hen again there are many other places nearby to do that in Madison.  Other BBQ places in town, chain and non-chain alike do a better BBQ.  The Haze will end up puttinf this place out of business if the BBQ does not improve.

The food was pretty good. Mac n cheese as a side was amazing with a plentiful serving. The turkey and brisket were alright, but I prefer sliced brisket to chopped. The server could have improved, but she seemed new.

I've both dined in and ordered online from Brickhouse. If you do go there to eat, sitting out back once it's warm out was awesome (even if maybe our service was a bit slower). The food and the BBQ specifically is good; certain plates on our table were better than others and I like the option of having 2 kinds of BBQ (2 meats) for a reasonable price so that you can try a few things. Our group did a lot of strategically different ordering and sharing of both meats & sides with this option. The pulled pork was great for sure. Ordering online was not nearly the same experience so if you must crave BBQ from your couch, go for it, but it's not nearly as fun as actually going to Brickhouse and smelling the deliciousness from the kitchen itself.

Lousy service... Literally charged us for things we didn't order and argued with us when it was time to pay the bill... And wouldn't change the amount 

Will never go there again because of terrible customer service 

A shame... The food was actually really pretty good

Ask me after my first visit, 5 stars.  It is too hit or miss.  They have some great cooks, and some mediocre ones.  I loved the chicken, portabella, tri tip, and catfish sandwiches on different occasions.  Fries are decent and mac n cheese was great.  The ribs were the firm style, not the moist, falling off the bone type I like.  I think that should be noted on the menu.  The past couple times, the mac n cheese was cold and unseasoned.  My mom's chicken sandwich was burnt.  The nachos were put together worse than a Taco Bell.  There was a huge, haphazard chunk of pork, another of sour cream, etc.  It really felt like they didn't give a s***.  I was also interested in having an event here prior to the last experience.  The hosts on 2 different occasions gave me the wrong email address.  I thought that I was being ignored but the events manager cleared that up.

Tl;dr.  Great rooftop, food is hit or miss.  At best, great.  At worst, not likely to come back.

We came in expecting to enjoy a selection of three beers on Thursday for Kill the Keg. We'd heard great things from friends and were excited to experience Kill the Keg. We were very disappointed to discover to learn that it was moved to a much worse night, Wednesday when we came in. Very disappointing.

I went here for dinner for my bachelor party and was very dissapointed. After our second round of drinks they took away all drink menus and then rufused to get us anymore drinks. The food was mediocre and took far longer than it should have. Then when it came to the bill, they charged my two drinks on three different bills for the full price as well as charging $1.50 for ice in a cocktail. Very dissapointing and I will never give them another chance for how we were treated.

Yeah...I remember why I don't eat here.

This is another one of those barbecue places where they just give you plain meat and expect you to figure out what kind of sauce you want. Only they don't tell you what the available sauces are. (Seriously - none of the bottles on our table were labeled.) When I order pulled pork (especially if it's topping an order of mac-n-cheese), I expect it to be sauced when I get it. Have you ever tried to sauce meat on top of mac-n-cheese without also saucing the mac-n-cheese? It doesn't work. And a main component of mac-n-cheese should be...wait for it...cheese. Something they (apparently) don't believe in at Brickhouse.

Our waitress was befuddled - and mostly absent - from start to finish. She told us she was new, so we tried to be understanding. But three of the four old-fashioneds ordered at our table (Korbel and Templeton rye - two rounds of each) were made incorrectly. As in...bourbon instead of Korbel in one of them, and who knows what was in either of the second-round drinks. I don't know if that was a server miscommunication or a bartender mistake, but it was absolutely ridiculous. Fortunately, we ordered the second round after we had paid for dinner, so we were able to just send the drinks back and move on to another venue.

In this case, permanently.

I've stopped going here because every time I do I feel neglected and rushed. Basically service sucks, and I've only gone when it's not busy so service should be better. The food is okay, good size portions but I'd look elsewhere.

Stopped in for a pint and a meal.  Was warmly greeted and promptly served.  The food was done perfectly and the taste was absolutely perfect.  Oh and they have trivia on Tuesday night which is an absolute blast.  Come to the Brickhouse you won't be disappointed.

Grossest beef brisket sandwich ever!! It was totally smothered in melted cheese so I couldn't see it at first, but one bite into it I realized it was mostly fat, no meat. I took it home so I could try to eat the meat out of it, but after picking through it, I found it maybe, at most, 10 % meat, 90 % fat. My wife ordered the pulled pork sandwich - that was quite fatty too, but not nearly as bad. Her coleslaw side was very bland, but well shredded, fresh & crisp. The white sandwich buns would've been much better if they'd been buttered & toasted. My seasoned/coated fries, ordered crispy, were nicely crisp & some of the better fires I've had in recent memory. Service was adequate, & the place appeared clean, although it was quite dark inside during our lunch visit. Why didn't I complain? I was using a Groupon coupon, so I didn't want to appear too cheap, but we would definitely never go back to this place!

At first, I really thought I was going to love this restaurant. 
The decor was trendy, inviting, and had plenty of space. (I'm sure when the weather is nice, the outdoor seating is a huge plus, too)
The drink menu looked interesting and had a large selection of hand selected beer on tap that the manager told us is updated monthly. Everything on the menu looked great; there were also a ton of great looking sides. Even the menus themselves looked good.
And obviously, who doesn't love BBQ?

Our beer came - I had the Bourbon Barrel Stout which is now very high on my favorite beer list. This dark beer had a ton of flavor but was not too heavy. Sarah also had a really good honey beer.

Then things started to go downhill.  
We passed on appetizers b/c the entrees came with two sides. And although we were watching the game and not in a hurry, the food was quite slow. Our manager/waiter told us we just happened to get behind two large tables...No problem, however this was the first day of spring break on campus and the place was less than 1/3 full - how do they keep up on full days? 

When the food came, overall it was average. The positives:
1. Mac n cheese - top notch
2. The three sauces: A BBQ place can be made or broke by its sauces. A molasses based, a vinegar based, and a mustard BBQ were all different and very good. And complemented the different meats well.

Negatives:
1. They serve the cornbread cold. Who does that?? It would have been pretty good, but I've never eaten cold cornbread!
2. My "Spicy green beans" were not spicy and were too crunchy - not even al dente.
3. Sweet potato salad although looked nice, the potatoes were also not evenly cooked. Some tender, some almost raw. Would have preferred if served warm.
4. All the "hot" food was just above warm and cooled off way to fast, possibly because it was quite cold in there. They may consider heating the plates, getting the food out quicker, or something else creative.

I had the meat combo: Chose the sausage and pulled pork. The sausage came with one spicy and one smoked served with pickled peppers. Pulled pork was good, but not amazing. Sarah had the chicken - moist and pretty good.

(Since I'm a sucker for dessert,) I finished off with the pecan tart because the manager said they have their own pastry chef. Well, there were only 4 desserts on the menu, which made me feeling like that chef is probably overpaid, but... Anyway, the tart came and was OK, but again, served cold. Everyone knows pecan pie is best warm. The custard that it was supposed to be served with, was nothing more than a smear of melted custard - yikes!!

Overall, we left feeling the food - which actually makes the restaurant - was just A-OK. However, we'll maybe come back to try out the outdoor seating in the summer.

Not at all my favorite. I can cook better BBQ at home. The place is ENTIRELY too loud. We got sat about 2 feet behind 3 people sitting at the bar and had to pull our table over so we didn't feel like were sitting on top of each other. If I ever visit Madison again I will not be stopping here!

We ordered take out from this restaurant with high expectations.  The pulled pork sandwich with fries and cheese grits were great.  The pork was very smoky and the cheese grits were rich and creamy.  However, my "bowl" of $5.50 chili came in an 8 oz container (the same size as the side of corn grits), and while good, was definitely not the filling portion I had expected and did not come with any garnishes.  Further, my side of green beans was shriveled and had obviously been sitting for a long period of time.  Maybe we'll try it again, but it's not at the top of my list after so much disappointment.
Came in for beer only and the menu is great! If you're into hard-to-craft craft brews, this is worth a look see. The service was fast, seating was plentiful and the bar was clean.

Hmm... after further review, I feel I need to be more critical. We didn't finish everything last night, so I can back for seconds this evening. Here are the final results:
The ribs were so full of fat, they were virtually inedible. It was hard to see all the fat through the dry rub caked on it. Again, no signs of ever having been smoked, either in flavor or color. I actually had a few bites of the ribs and tossed them. If you know me, tossing ribs is sacreligious.

The brisket sandwich. Brisket? It tastes like the onion strings or rings or whatever they covered all the brisket in. After extracting the layers of fried onion strings, I tried the sandwich again... and guess what folks - the brisket had no flavor. I had to put BBQ saue on the brisket sandwich to get some taste in it.

I'm not sure what Brickhouse is going for here, but it does make me sad to give a bad review. Maybe it was a bad day for them? I'll try again one of these days... but not any time soon.


Fourteen years ago,  friend and I walked around the downtown Madison area in a fruitless search of anything barbeque... chicken, ribs, riblets, even the fake shit, smoked and slathered in sauce would have sufficed. Anyhow, 14 years later, someone came up with the brilliant idea of opening a barbeque joint on campus. It's a nice looking spot, and it appears to have a variety of different beers and liquors in addition to their BBQ, also nice to see in the campus area. Unfortunately, the BBQ itself was so so. I expected far better, but then again, I've always said that expectation is the king of all let down. The other criticism is that for the campus area, the pricepoint is pretty damn high. I know decent BBQ doesn't come cheap, but you also have to consider your location. If you are wondering, we had the ribs and a brisket sandwich. The ribs were okay, and I didn't see any of the telltale signs of having been smoked. They were chewy, which some people like - I don't. The brisket sandwich was rich and also lacking in flavor. The mac n' cheese was pretty basic - lacking in flavor. The chipotle smoked sweet potato salad was interesting, and the french fries - well how can you screw those up? Those were decent. Service was adequate and there was plenty of seating when we went. If I'm going to drop a couple bucks on BBQ, I'm going to pass on the ambiance of the downtown/campus area, and head over to Smoky Jon's.

Went yesterday and they said they were under new management. There's only 2 entrees, 3 sandwiches, and 5 sides on their little temporary menu. The window said they had ribs but apparently not last night. 3 of us got the brisket and one the pulled pork. They were all thick sliced and not real tender. The brisket was a pretty fatty and just ok. The fries - waffle cut and sweet potato - were very good. The cole slaw was so so. It's a nice place inside, but hope they can improve.

This place has a really clean, modern atmosphere. I went there a couple times the week it first opened with three friends from the Carolinas and they were quite ecstatic to finally find decent BBQ and sweet tea in Madison. I always leave with my meat craving satisfied.

Service is always friendly, but don't expect to be in and out in half an hour. It's not that type of joint. Drinks are better than average for Madison too.

Did not intend to eat there, but got caught in a rain storm and it was nearest available spot. They are having issues with their tap system so, as others have noted, the beer was a bit warm and the selection was not as large as it typically would be. I had the shrimp and polenta dish and it was excellent, as was the side of spicy green beans.

Really wanted to like this place but. . .    Food started out good with the pulled pork quesadia which was very good.  Lots of flavor and juicy.  Came with sour cream and some spicy salsa.  

But then dinner came. If it hadn't been for the appetizer, this place would have only gotten 1 star.   I had the flatiron steak which would have been good if cooked to medium.  It arrived more well done.  I was going to send it back but my spouse told me to just eat it.  Not much flavor and the BBQ sauces that were brought out to us didn't help much.  One was a molasses based sauce that was way too sweet.  Then a vinegar sauce which was too sour and a mustard sauce that might as well been a bottle of Grey Poupon.  I like Grey Poupon, just not as a BBQ sauce.

Worse were the ribs that my wife got.  VERY dry to the point of being crispy.  Talk about a waste of good meat.  Some of the worst ribs I have ever tasted.  

I was so hoping this would bring Madison a good BBQ place but it doesn't make the grade.

I'm a big fan of Brickhouse. To me, high quality meat is what makes great BBQ, and Brickhouse does it right. The pulled pork and brisket are really delicious, and the mac & cheese is really good too. Definitely try the mustard-style BBQ sauce on your pulled pork, even if it sounds weird (most northerners don't associate mustard with BBQ, but I appreciate the fact that Brickhouse has a good selection of regional sauces). Also, the jalapeno cornbread is to die for.

Another thing that really impresses me about Brickhouse is their great selection of bourbons and other whiskeys. They actually stock Pappy Van Winkle's, which makes me really happy - but also really frustrated since I can't not drink it, and of course it's just as expensive as everywhere else (naturally - but so worth it). Try the flight that includes the 10 year!
Great food and atmosphere. Except the macaroni and cheese was a little cold. The hostess was not at the stand for a noticeable time and had us waiting.

Yelp is right on this one. 

SLOW service on a SLOW night (multiple times to ask for one drink, brought one drink at a time, mixed up tickets, missing items, slow refills, etc...)
Dry pork sandwich
Brisket was chewy
Sauces were not good, nor helpful
Boring mac and cheese
Didn't have the beer I wanted (even though there is a big draft selection: many IPAs)
Chicken wings were not habanero, nor very spicy
Green beans were RAW and also not "spicy" at all


Only good: 
Turkey was moist, mild smoke flavor, still warm. Would ONLY get this again. Asked for the raspberry junk sauce on the side, never got it, glad I didn't. 2/5

On BBQ list, this place ranks 10th, which is last place.

We rented out the top floor for a wedding rehearsal. It was perfect- we rented the patio as well so it was only our guests allowed. The food was great and brought out timely. The bartenders were very nice and great with keeping track of the open bar tab. The bar staff also accommodated our requests to play a slideshow and music. We also ran out of apps so were able to place an order for more with no problem.
David, the manager, was very easy-going from the start. He is best by email and was very flexible. He even let my mom bring her cheesecakes in early for storage. They were great!

Was just... alright. Many reviewers have it dead on. Great atmosphere and okay food. Definitely far from being what it could be. They need a new chef or someone to tell them how to property do BBQ. Cold corn bread? Ribs just okay, a little fatty and chewy. I got the two mean platter and it came with 1 half slice of ham that was 1/4 inch thick. Mac and cheese was great, but the beans and apple sauce were just okay. I want to like this place as I could be here weekly if they could do true BBQ.
Great outside patio! This is the second time I've eaten here and have nothing bad to say! The food and service is great and the atmosphere is wonderful. Definitely coming back again and again.

Hoooo, boy.  Where do I begin?  Let me start by saying that, while not native Southerners, the boyfriend and I spent the last several years living in Memphis, one of the BBQ capitals of the nation.  They take BBQ VERY seriously in Memphis, and it is everywhere.  After years of living around the corner from some of the best BBQ in town, we have been absolutely appalled at what passes for BBQ up here, and Brickhouse was Exhibit A.

Let me set the stage -- it was a hot Sunday afternoon, around 2pm.  Not a busy time; in fact, the beautiful, multi-floor restaurant was practically deserted.  Lured by the promise of a rooftop patio, we schlepped up the stairs, only to discover that, oddly enough, there were no umbrellas.  Those few brave patrons up there were baking in the sun, and not wishing to freeze in the air conditioning inside, we joined them...after I ran back downstairs, and up again, for sunscreen and a hat from the car.

Craving something cold and alcoholic at this point, but not being a beer drinker, I asked our waitress to tell me about the whopping 2 hard ciders on the menu (1 apple, 1 pear).  She mumbled something about not really knowing anything about them and settled for bringing me tasting portions from the bar.  Ok, fine.  I settled on the pear, and we ordered food.

Our fried duck wings eventually came out, and they were a disappointment.  If I hadn't known they were duck, I never would have guessed, and the overly sweet sauce they were served with didn't add anything.  And then.  And then.  Halfway through our appetizer, the waitress appeared with our entrees.  My pet peeve.  

Rather than send them back, and risk having them sit under a warming lamp in the kitchen, we made room on the table and dug in.  My pulled pork was not spectacular, and I didn't like any of the 3 sauces on the table -- all of them seemed to have a great deal of black pepper in them, and were somehow not quite an appealing consistency.  The boyfriend's ribs were a major disappointment, clearly having been braised or otherwise cooked without benefit of a smoker, which is the whole point of BBQ (he actually commented on entering the restaurant that he didn't smell their smoker, which is a bad sign -- no smoker means no true BBQ).  

His green beans, described as spicy, were not at all, and the final straw for me was discovering that my mac 'n cheese was cold.  Cold enough that I suspected that it had been the first thing put on the plate waaaay downstairs in the kitchen, waited for the rest of my food, and, by the time it made it up several flights to me, had died a sad, quiet death.  When I pointed this out to the waitress she brought me a fresh portion (which was actually hot), but may I remind you that the restaurant was practically empty?  And who serves cold mac 'n cheese??

At this point, having been roasting in the sun for an hour and been served a poor excuse for BBQ, we paid the $60 bill and left.  Asked on the way out how it was, I commented on the lack of umbrellas on the patio and was given a lame excuse about how they were replacing the worn-out ones.  Uh, could you keep the old ones til the new ones came?  So your patrons don't die out there?

So if this is "the best BBQ in Madison," that is a very sad statement.  If you don't know what BBQ is, you might like Brickhouse, but please, stay away.  Far away.

Recently went to the Brickhouse barbecue in Madison Wisconsin. As much as I hate to do this, I'm giving a mixed review.

On the plus side, the selection of craft beers on tap is nothing short of amazing. It's clear that the bartender knows what he's doing and is able to make expert recommendations --very knowledgeable.  The other positive thing is that the meets are very well prepared. I have the brisket which was so tender it almost melted in my mouth. My guest had the pulled pork that was fantastic. The barbecue sauces varied from sweet to spicy -- nice selection.

The drawback were that the Side dishes were a disappointment -- although the spicy beans were Nice and spicy, they were overcooked. The cornbread was also over baked and dried out. To Make a complete meal excellent you got to cover all the bases with excellent food preparation.
Service was fast and food was great! Good BBQ flavor and sizable portions.  Full bar with a nice row of tap.  Atmosphere was casual and easy -
I was hesitant to try another barbecue place in Madison, after being disappointed with the last three! Had a fantastic meal tonight. The chicken was so tender it fell off the bone.

I wish I had read the rest of the reviews before coming here. 

We walked in and we're the only people there. Despite this fact, our food took close to 40 minutes to get after ordering. The excuse we were given was that there was only one cook due to food vendors being out on the square. I am not sure why the management would not increase the staff at the actual restaurant to accommodate this. Despite the fact that there may or may not have been only a single cook, it is a barbecue restaurant. Most of this meat has already been slow cooking for hours. There shouldn't have been much to prepare, and we were the only people in the restaurant. 

Moving on to the food, the brisket was good but the ribs were not. They were over seasoned and over cooked. Additionally, when I pay $16 for a BBQ platter I expect to see a plethora of meat. This was not the case. Lastly, the sauces they give are below average. There's only 3 options and none of them are standout. 

Overall, I would not recommend going here. There's about a hundred other restaurants on State Street that I'm sure beat this place out.

I'm not a big barbeque person, but I liked the food. I got the pulled pork sandwich. I'm a fan of the sauces on the side - mostly because I don't like barbeque sauce that much. Definitely not anywhere near the best, but it's reasonably priced. Plus, there's a huge selection of beers on tap. The sides are all very good - loved the cornbread and the grits.

Service: Meh. Nothing happened that would make me say it's bad, but I also don't remember my servers even checking on my table more than once.
Environment: The place is huge. I worried they would have trouble filling it, but the second time I went, it was packed and there was a 30 minute wait.

Background notes: went with a group of about 10 friends on a Wednesday night, also went with the family on a Saturday night.

This place in my opinion makes one of the top 3 burgers in Madison.  Cooked over a flame the Bacon Bourbon Burger with some sort of aoli on it is money.  However I have been moderately happy or disappointed every time I have ate the ribs (were smoked days prior), brisket or pulled pork.  If you stick to the burgers this place is awesome!

Stopped by because of Madison Mag review. Bartender was very friendly and helpful. Place was fairly busy and everyone seemed friendly. Unfortunately the food was a disappointment. Ribs were tough, brisket dry and tasteless. Mac and cheese was closer to Mac, little cheese. Slaw was good, I would recommend it. I would come here to drink, love the atmosphere. Forgot to mention, the duck legs were very good.

I guess these guys had a staff party the night before, because 3 of their staff loomed around the bar complaining about being hungover while I waited for service. 

Service-ok
Food-ok
Beer Selection-Pretty good. 
Also they are right next to a great liquor store with a fantastic beer selection-Must go over there

I had the beef brisket sandwich.  It was good and 
I would go there again and order it.  Having said that...

The brisket can't be ordered as just an entree, which made me skeptical about its quality, but the sandwich was alright.  The meat was tender, but not melt in my mouth tender.  The meat was a little too salty and didn't have enough of that beef fat taste.  The mustard sauce was good with it but took over the flavors too much (or the meat didn't have enough flavor to begin with?  The roll it came with was good/standard and the crispy onion strings on it topped it offed nicely.  The french fries came pre-seasoned and were cooked well.  

Big portion, friendly service, and yummy taste.

I don't know why this place has so few stars. The food was really good. Now, I typically like my BBQ sauces to hit me a bit more, but that's a personal preference. I mixed the mustard and original sauce and liked the result. But the pulled pork is so delicious that you can eat it without any sauce, and the beans were really awesome (though I would have preferred spicier) and collards were good too. 
And as for the service: wow! The waitress was super attentive, even with juggling several other tables. The bartender did a great job recommending some rye whiskey for me, and even sent over some van winkle when they didn't have one of the ryes that came with my flight. The prices were very reasonable as well. They even have several teas to choose from, which was a surprise at a BBQ place. Definitely will be coming back.

Oh, and I think it's awesome that they have a unisex bathroom.

A group of friends dined here one evening as Brickhouse BBQ was a venue for "Paint Nite".  I was pleased with the large variety of beers to choose from. I choose a seasonal local beer, and I could have sworn I wasn't given the correct beer as it didn't taste like it.
I ordered the Brisket sandwich. I liked that they had 3 different BBQ sauces to choose from on the table, you can choose which one you like best and use as much or as little sauce on your sandwich as you like. My sandwich was supposed to come with coleslaw on the sandwich which it didn't so the waitress had to get some from the kitchen. The meat on the sandwich was tender, but it was swimming in grease. The bottom of my bun was quickly soggy from all the grease.  The service overall was sub par (they were not busy either when we were dining)
Overall it tasted OK. As far as dining here again? I could take it or leave it.

This isn't a bad place to get a burger, but you're really much better off going to Dotty's around the corner or even Five Guys up on State if that's what you're looking for. The meat is obviously pressed.

I decided to give the ribs a try one night, but wasn't too impressed. They were pretty dry and difficult to eat. The sauce was lacking, but you will always get brought a plate full of interesting signature sauces to top your food with.

I love the mac and cheese here. Incredibly cheesy, large elbows cooked to exactly the right toughness/softness, and topped with a delicious blend of spices and bread crumbs. The coleslaw is extremely bland, and should be avoided. French fries were your average thin cut with an average seasoning salt, nothing you couldn't get anywhere else. Get the fried onion strings on anything and everything that you can get it with - they're excellent thanks to a crispy and well-seasoned batter.

Service is standard good, which is sometimes a hard thing to get in Madison. The wait staff is friendly and will be happy to immediately get you anything you need. The atmosphere is also pretty nice, with a pleasant patio out back and nice hardwood floors and brick walls inside.

All in all, I've had extremely average dining experiences in here. I wouldn't recommend going out of your way to try it, but take a look at their menu. If you're looking for something in particular, it might be worth a shot.

I like the food, but my husband is less of a fan.  The real issue is the service - it is unreasonably slow and more often than not incompetent with dishes being served late, cold, or just plain wrong.  It's a pity because like I said, I like the food...

Holy Mac N Cheese 

If you've had it...you know what I'm talking about. If you haven't.. you need to. I'm not going to be snobbish to the point that I'll say I've grown out of mac n cheese. Having established that, I'd like to think myself a connoisseur of the delicacy. Brickhouse's Mac N Cheese was quite possibly the best I've ever had, and I've had a lot of it.  

I rounded off the meal with the Brisket, which was also very good. Our waiter was a decently nice fellow, and nothing to complain about. 

I really liked the environment of the place, but it seems as if they're struggling to find their identity still. 

All in all, it was a 3.5-4.5/5 and I'll definitely be back

This place seems to garner a lot of mixed reviews, but luckily for me, I had a great experience here this past Saturday.

To start off with, our waitress was extremely friendly and accommodating, and really knew her alcohol (always a plus).

I was rather surprised by their large and interesting selection of beer, given that it's a BBQ place. 

I was feeling adventurous, and went with their Founders Dirty Bastard. You're already getting a pretty good deal for the price ($5) to alcohol ratio (8.3%), and it only gets better when you realize it doesn't taste like crap. It tasted like any dark ale to me, so there's not much to complain.

My friends went with the WTF (tastes kinda like warp speed) and Ace Berry Cider (tastes kinda like berry juice, aka for pansies); 

Aside from the beer, their BBQ's pretty good too :p

They have 3 delicious sauces available, and you can get as many refills as you want.

I ordered a Brickhouse Brisket entree, which is smoked brisket laid over a piece of toast, all served with cornbread and 2 sides. Now that may sound like a lot of food, but... never mind, who am I kidding. It's a lot of food. You're definitely going to be full.

Their beef was pretty tender, but didn't really stand out much besides that. I also wish they had more meat, and maybe less starch, but I'm over it.

What's ironic is that instead of their brisket, which should be the best part of ya know, a BBQ dish, it's their sides that truly shine. The cornbreads might be my favorite part, because not only is it sweet, it also had bits of jalapeno(?) to give it a kick. 

The toast was also great, as its crunchy texture really added some needed pizazz to the meal. I got a side of crisp and spicy green beans (meh) and braised collard greens & ham (better than meh).     
 
So overall, a pretty filling meal with a variety of taste, more good than bad :)

One star for the great beer selection. They use the work "smoke" a lot but I don't know why. You will notice that you never smell smoke inside or outside this place. They must not have a smoker or it was off line when I was there. Smoked chicken wings? No smoke. Ribs and brisket? No visible evidence of smoking used in the cooking process. Most likely used smoke flavoring in sauce or marinade/rub. Looking for authentic smoked BBQ? Look elsewhere. Very disappointed and will not be back. Wasn't even a good fraudulent attempt.

We tried Brickhouse BBQ for dinner this past weekend. What stood out was that this is a three story restaurant and the top floor includes an outdoor eating patio. With three stories, Brickhouse can accommodate a lot of patrons. We were there on a Friday night around dinner time. It was not particularly busy. All of that space made it seem almost empty. We opted to eat outside, on the third floor patio, where you can look down on the street and across to the surrounding buildings.

Our waitress was friendly, not particularly knowledgeable about the extensive beer list, but perky and likeable. The beer list is not only extensive but reasonably priced.

The menu included some oddities such as duck legs, various styles of Mac & Cheese including Cajun and chipotle, and appetizers like the trio of fries which included potato, sweet potato and zucchini. I give it props for variety and originality. I ordered the smoked turkey and my partner had the sausage combo. The turkey was moist, tender, and already sauced so I didn't need to add any of the additional sauces available at the table. It comes with corn-bread which I found dense and grainy but I did enjoy the sweet crust on top. For sides I ordered the braised collard greens with ham and maple mashed sweet potatoes. The saltiness of the ham complimented the bitterness of the greens. I didn't get much maple in the sweet potatoes.

I really liked being able to sit outside on the roof, the food was tasty and unusual and the service was fine. I would go back.

When I have been here, I was not very impressed.   The meat lacked good color and texture.  I found the sauces were designed to mask the flaws of the meat.  I might be being too harsh but as someone who loves BBQ this is not a place I would recommend.
The pork and brisket were depressingly bland. No salt, no fat, and no smoke flavor. I've had better pot roast. The sides were just as an unimpressive.

When the Mac is good, it's the best in town - but at times they don't put enough cheese on it so it turns out like buttered noodles. Other than the Mac, which is my favorite item on the menu, the food is pretty good, definitely not great. They have an excellent selection of brew though and and VERY friendly staff which keeps me coming back.

The third floor is also a sick place to host a group event, if you're in to that kind of thing. Oh, and in the summer the roof deck is a chill spot to kick it.
Great portions. Ribs were a bit dry but good. Amazing price though. The Mac and cheese was delicious and so were the potatoes

This was our second time visiting Brickhouse and had another great time. This is the kind of BBQ place that you add your own sauce. Spicy and/or Sweet as you like it. The sides were fresh and a good compliment to the meal. They have a HUGE selection of local microbrews on tap.  The waiters helped a lot here and brought us se samples to help us select.

I think this place is generally underrated. I've had BBQ in Memphis, KC, and I spent a year in STL and ate at all the best places there. Brickhouse isn't the nut high, but it's not an embarrassment either. 

Get the: 

Cornbread (moist! some of the best), Cajun Sausage, Chimichurri Steak (such flavor, cooked perfectly), Mac and Cheese, Garlic Smashed Mashed Potatoes (incredible). 

Avoid the: 

Ribs (lol), Spicy Green Beans (aka normal green beans),

Good Lord. Ignore the reviews by the college kids. They expect everything to taste like perfection and have the staff wipe their mouth after every bite.

My girlfriend and I had just come back from doing some hiking on a brisk day and needed something to fill and warm us up. We both ordered the Brickhouse Mac & Cheese. Sounded like a perfect blend of cheesy pasta with pulled pork, brisket and two bones of ribs. It also comes with a side of cornbread. 

The pasta was delicious and the ribs were cooked perfectly. The brisket was a little scarce but overall it was a fantastic dish. 

It was a Friday afternoon and only a few people were dining. We were acknowledged right away  when we came in and our waiter frequently came by to check on our food and drinks. 

Only complaint of this place? The barbecue sauces on the table weren't labeled and golf was playing on TV. Other than that I highly recommend this restaurant and look forward to coming here again.

Fantastic beer selection and decent food. The BBQ pulled pork is always a favorite. Two thumbs up for the catfish sandwich and the 1/2 lb. burger, but don't order the chicken chili - gross! The good food made up for the terrible service. Our waiter was stressed out because they were understaffed during the rush before the Men's basketball game. I kinda felt bad for his situation, but he was very unprofessional and just plain rude. We love the roof-top terrace in the summer, so we might be back in when it's warmer.
Engaging service thanks Phil.  Enjoyed the food.  The only issue was the size of the booth.  Kinda small for four people.
been there twice. had ribs once, and steak once.  thought it was above average both times and very delicious sides and  beers

This place has everything to be a successful establishment--great food, good tap list, rooftop seating, great specials, and good prices. I've been a few times, and I want to really like this place. Unfortunately, although service is very nice, it is extremely slow, and taps were quite warm, which was off-putting.  With some tweaks, this place could be great, but I'm not sure that I'll go back.

Um wow I had really high hopes the place is well decorated , cloth napkins, nice decor but it was a fail on every level. I joined a group for dinner, wasn't asked if I wanted a beverage as water was on the table. I ordered the brisket with fries and coleslaw and there  really wasn't hardly anything edible on the plate. The brisket was literally stone cold served in a piece of cold bread, not like it had sat for a while but like so cold it had been refrigerated and then served. The fries were all coated in a super spicy seasoning so much that you couldn't even taste the potato, also cold fries. The coleslaw hi we're was not cold it was very unique that the meat get colder than the coleslaw. The server never really showed up except to deliver food and then the check. I love bbq and am sorry to say the mc rib had better barbecue flavor than this brisket.

Went here for a group dinner.  First walking in, things at least smelled promising (ahhh, the smell of smoked bbq).  Alas, the meat did not hold up to the promise.  On offer we had ribs, pulled pork and some sort of beef (steak medallions or something like that).  Pulled pork was rather dry and less than tender (and there was no bbq sauce to go with it).  I didn't have the other 2 meats, but multiple others in our party did and everyone was less than impressed with the quality of the meat (kind of important for a bbq joint).

We also had cheese curds, salad, potato salad, mashed potatoes and sweet potato fries (guess they must have a stockpile of potatoes).  I didn't have the salad, but both the mashed and sweet potato fries were delicious.  The cheese curds were subpar (everyone also thought the same...they tasted like they were over-fried and had been sitting around for awhile).

Then for dessert there was a turtle cheesecake -  AWESOME!  but, they didn't have enough for the whole group?!?  When we asked for more so everyone could have some, we were told there wasn't any more, so they brought out brownies and turtle bars.  I didn't have either, but the brownies were praised, as were the turtle bars.  

So the food seems very hit-or-miss.  If you think it's worth the chance, you might give it a shot...but I would recommend looking for some better options.  (Note:  As a group, we had buffet-style food, so possibly this affected quality, but nonetheless you would think if they want people to come back, they would try harder.  Guess they don't care, and I won't be back.)

This place is huge, which is good when you have a group of people and are looking for a table.  The portions are huge and the sauces are tasty.  I wish they had a little bit more char or texture, but why nit pick.

The previous reviews kind of scared us but we really enjoyed this restaurant.

The food was great - my husband and I shared two dinners - rack of ribs and the sausage combo platter.  Sides were fries, mac and cheese (recommended by server), cinnamon apples, and cheesy grits.  Mac and cheese needed seasoning,but after I tried the ribs and sausage I didn't mind - they were so delicious and full of flavor that the mac anc cheese was kind of the calm in the storm.

I had a Louisville Swigger (peach puree with house made bourbon) and it was OUT OF THIS WORLD.  My husband had a couple of the 40+ beers on tap.  No complaints in the drink department!

Our service was a little hit or miss (slow drinks, could be bar's fault) ... we didn't get side plates for our appetizer or a plate/bucket/bowl for our ribs, but we made do.  There are bigger problems in life.

Ask for a window seat if you go.  We had so much fun people watching in this eclectic college town.  The best part of the night was watching college students paying certain individuals to buy them booze at the liquor shop next door to the restaurant and then picking up their booze in the alley next to the restaurant.  We were very entertained!

Overall this is a nice restaurant - great food at a really decent price.

After a recent meal at the haze i was very happy to have a much better meal at brickhouse. The decor is very upscale for a barbecue restaurant, which was surprising, but the meal more than lived up to expectations. I had the pulled pork and ribs which were both quite good. The three sauces were interesting; sweet and tangy was really more a sweet apple flavor, but the vineagar based was excellent on the pork and mustard was slightly spicy with an interesting tang. The ribs didn't need sauce at all, and my sides of mac & cheese and black eye pea fricassee were both quite good. Overall, would definitely try again.

Tried Brickhouse BBQ when my brother was visiting from out of state and we noticed the deal they had on Groupon. When we entered the building and saw the signs advertising the daily specials, my brother and husband were elated to learn we were dining here on $2.50 Pabst pitchers & $1 sliders night. More a Mountain Dew fan than a beer drinker, I was happy to see they serve Pepsi products. The sliders were great, and definitely worth the $1 price. They offer many menu options I haven't seen on other BBQ restaurant menus, such as numerous mac & cheese dishes. I ordered the chipotle mac, which I enjoyed (especially the generous amount of chicken included), but because the amount of chipotle sauce was much more than I was expecting, I think next time I would opt for the basic mac & cheese. My husband ordered ribs, which he really enjoyed, and my brother was impressed with the brisket dish he ordered. Great food all around! Our waitress was friendly, but could have been more attentive, as she seemed to disappear often and we had to wait quite a while to get menus, refills, and our bill. Loved the feel of this place, especially with the exposed brick interior walls and open, roomy feeling layout. Was a fun, warm atmosphere we really liked. The only negative I have about this place, as some other reviews mentioned, is I wish the bbq sauce was labeled, but our waitress was knowledgeable of the flavors of each-no big deal. Really enjoyed our experience here and will definitely be back!

It was mediocre at best. When I want barbecue, I want something that is super saucy and delicious with a kick to it. I ordered the Hawaiian Pork only to find that it was way too sweet for my taste. The sauce was barely there and Brickhouse doesn't seem to offer anything spicy to tone down the sugar. If I wanted that much sugar, I would have ordered ice cream! I realize it was supposed to be a little sweet, but good grief! My boyfriend ordered the chimichurri steak. He was surprised to see how small of a serving it was for the high cost of the dish. Plus, the meat was tough and hard to chew. It had good flavor, but was not worth the price. The green beans lacked any spice, whatsoever. We'd be up for trying some of the mac n' cheese next time to try other items on the menu. The servers were nice and they have other interesting items on the menu that we'd be willing to check out next time.

I might be a harsh critic because I'm from Texas.. The new was okay. I ordered brisket there, but it wasn't really brisket... It was chopped brisket..the taaste was okay, but one of the most important things in bbq is  the sauce.. And their sauce was very mediocre. If you're in Madison and craving bbq I would be okay with eating here, but it definitely does not compared to Texas bbq

Had dinner there a few weeks after it opened and wasn't pleased. I had the BBQ pulled pork, that literally had no BBQ on it and was drier than the desert. My boyfriend and our guest got the full rack of ribs. Nether were pleased or happy with their choice. The bartender didn't know the beers they had on tap and seemed pretty out of it.  They did let us sit on the rooftop and brought our food up for us, as it was later there was no server waiting upstairs. It has a nice view from the rooftop, but thats honestly the only good thing I have to say.

We are always in search of good quality "fall-off-the-bone" ribs. When searching yelp to help us locate a new place to try we found Brickhouse Barbeque. The pictures looked interesting and we decided to give it a shot. We were very pleased and have now been back several times. The ribs were tender, sauce was flavorful, the sides (garlic mashed potatoes) were very good, portion sizes were generous and the service was helpful and courteous. The decor is minimal, but appropriate for a near campus restaurant. We will definitely be back.

I remember when this place opened, and how they have some nice patio seating. We decided to sit inside this time, right next to the bar.
Everyone liked the Southern Mac n'Cheese. I was not impressed, plus it was cold. My friend whose lived in NOLA for 2 years, said her grits were mostly liquid, not grits. The cornbread, was bland and cold. The roasted chicken was pretty good.
Only one veggie option for my veggie friend.
The drinks were good, and cheap. But overall I was unimpressed with the quality of food. 
Not enough Comfort in this pseudo Southern establishment.

How have I not reviewed Brickhouse? I come here so often, it's kind of ridiculous! Mostly because it's close to my house, but also because it's so delicious.

I've had a variety of items here: burgers, quesadillas, mac and cheese, cornbread (and cornbread alone), and lots and lots of beer. I've been here for: date night, meetings, pre-interview mixers, drinks, etc. And every time I've had a great experience. 

This place is underrated for casual drinks. Boyfriend and I come here often on the weekdays to grab a beer or two and maybe even an app to share. Beware--kitchen closes at 10, so make sure you get here before then.

The vibe at Brickhouse is awesome. Three floors and an outdoor patio. OBSESSED with the patio! It's the perfect place to sit out in the summertime, both during the day and at night. They have wood chairs and tables with umbrellas and string lights surrounding the patio. It's intimate and fun to come here at night. 

I've also come here in a big group once or twice (once during a basketball game!) and the waitresses have been very accommodating to us. Sure, service was a little slow during that basketball game, but it wasn't anything worth noting. 

Regarding food: Always hot and fresh. GET THE CORNBREAD. It is SO good (and I'm usually a cornbread hater). I also love any of their mac and cheeses, they are seriously divine. The best mac and cheese in Madison.

Regarding beer selection: vast! Their taps rotate regularly, so I am always very satisfied with their selection. Boyfriend liked their Old Fashioned, but said it was not the best he has had. They did muddle it correctly, so he was happy.

Great place for beers and dinner with friends. Try it!

We were here when they first opened and again recently.  Meh, is all I can say.  They seem to have a problem serving items at a good temperature for the food.  The beer was barely cold, and the food was barely warm.    The mac n cheese was good, but would have been better served hot.  The Turkey BLT was actually good, but the brisket was just okay and again, barely warm.  I ordered an unsweetened iced tea, which I do often at restaurants.  It really tasted bad.  I mentioned it to our server and she said she would tell the bartender about it.  Unfortunately, she did not remove it from the bill.   We didn't make a stink about the $2.50, but if something as cheap as iced tea is returned, it should be removed from the bill.   She was not a bad server, but I didn't get the feeling from anyone in there that they wanted to "serve" people.  They were just there to do their job.  I do not recommend this place.   You can get better food and service elsewhere.

The good:
 *The interior is awesome - they must have spent a ton of $$$ to make that three story beauty possible,
 *Outdoor patio
 *The on tap beer selection is legit - I think its around 50 different beers.
 *Prices are fair (especially on beer!)
 *Cornbread is very good

The un-good: 
 *The food is just decent - it doesn't pop. I wouldn't avoid, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. I think I tried a bunch of different meats too, but was underwhelmed.
 *The service isn't great

This is fucking stupid. Their speakers don't work. Like I'm sorry don't have a fucking Social if your speakers don't work. Also, when I asked they were rude about the speakers which is unnecessary considering I'm already paying these ridiculous prices!! Sad!!

I first ate at Brickhouse at least a year ago or more when there was a Groupon special.  At the time, I didn't think it was much to write home about - another bbq place in Madison, whoo.  My reaction changed going there a second time this past weekend.  It was packed on a Friday night, and the food was pretty spectacular. 

I ordered the two meat combo. The ribs are delicious, the brisket was only so-so. The sides were delicious - the spicy green beans, the corn bread, and the yukon potato salad was really, really good.  

My husband ordered the bbq spaghetti, which by the way was huge, and i really enjoyed his dish as well.  it had a spicy and tart kick to it, with fresh tomatoes, and a hint of bbq and lots of meat sprinkled over it (see my photos). 

We will be coming back to try the other main and side dishes.  The cheese curds were also really tasty.  

There are three types of sauces on each table, two of which are bbq and the third which seemed like a really sweet and vinegary mustard.

Have I had better bbq. Yes. Brisket improves much with the sauce selection. But everyone who works here is super nice and helpful. I am currently staring at a wall of 40 drafts all styles of which less than a handful are "volume" non craft beers. I myself see at least 10 that are very very good. This place is Comfortable and well stocked.

The food? Not so good. I've been there 4 or 5 times for dinner, and every time the barbecue has been underwhelming, at best. On the flip-side, they've got pretty good side dishes--the spicy green beans are always winners.

A little hint for Brickhouse: You need to mix the sauce in with your meat. The pulled pork is awfully dry without it--let it stew in that stuff...or at least its own juices! Sheesh.

Now, the great: Awesome beer selection. Whoever's choosing taps really knows their stuff--5 stars on tap quality, but food ain't so good, so we round 'em out at 3.

Three starts gets it exactly right. The interior is nice and well constructed, the waitstaff is nice. Worth a stop-by for some OK bbq and a drink.

Burger = good but not great

Catfish platter = good

Brisket = OK

Sides: 

Mac and cheese = bad

Fries = good

Green beans = good

Beans = OK

Potato salad = bad

Cornbread = OK but dry

Sauces = OK

Beer selection = good

One of our favorite bbq places and in Madison. Seems to always be pretty quiet in there. Foods delicious, really good mac and cheese, pulled pork, blackened catfish and house bbq sauce. Price is good, we have eaten there maybe 10 times now in the last few years and only complaint is we wish the food was warmer. Corn bread is tasty! Not much for parking, gorgeous roof top patio for summer.

Uuummm...it wasn't bad. 

I ordered the Brickhouse Brisket, which I thought would be extremely tender. Not so much. It was actually a little tough, especially the ends. The flavor was good and the meat was cooked to medium rare as I'd requested, but I wouldn't order it again. The cornbread and mashed potatoes I ordered on the side were actually much better than the entree. Hmph. 

My fiance had the ribs, which he enjoyed, but wasn't up to par with his favorites based on how it fell off the bone. Or how it didn't. He enjoyed using the mango habanero sauce on the meat though. Fries were good, beans were okay. 

Overall, not a place we would jump at the chance to come back to. At least the service was great!

Brickhouse BBQ is a gorgeous restaurant.  We were seated almost immediately and brought waters.  We had to wait a little while until our order was taken.  I got the ribs, mashed potatoes, and creamy coleslaw.  I get this same combination at every BBQ joint I go to.  The ribs were not tender.  They were gritty (I'm assuming because of the rub the cooks used).  The coleslaw was not creamy at all.  However, the mashed potatoes were excellent.  They had large portions of everything, which would have been nice if I had enjoyed their food.  My boyfriend at the brisket sandwich and he didn't even eat half the sandwich.  It was extremely dry.  The service was kind of bad as well.  Our waters didn't get refilled once before we left (and they were both completely empty).

We didn't originally plan on eating here, but after the two places we originally planned on eating at in the Madison area were closed, We took a look on Yelp and this placed looked pretty promising. After driving around the area attempting to find parking, i FINALLY found parking a block or two west of the restaurant for like $1.50 which isn't bad.  Once we got to the restaurant it was pretty quiet the hostess asked if we wanted to sit on the 3rd floor patio, So we said sure since it was beautiful outside.  The 3rd floor patio is really THEE place to sit if you have the option to do so. 

The Server was a little off, not sure if she had a long day, or what but she could have been a bit nicer but everyone has their day. The menu is pretty good sized,  We decided to have the cheese curds to start the meal and the "bbq ranch" dip they have is GREAT. I use the words "bbq ranch" loosely as thats what they call it, but i don't know if i could find either flavor either way it is awesome. The Curds themselves were quite good as well. I decided to order the Pulled Pork with a side of the spicy green beans and Mac & Cheese, My fiance ordered the Brickhouse BBQ Mac & Cheese. a few minutes later our food came out, and i couldn't believe the portion my fiance got, 2 bones of Ribs, some Brisket, and some pulled pork AND the mac & Cheese also a piece of cornbread.
