She enjoyed everything except the cornbread as she is a fan of your traditional sweet  cornbread and their's is a little more on the savory side with a hint of peppers, Not bad just not my preference for cornbread either. My Pulled pork was very good, as was their house BBQ Sauce that i used. the real surprise for me was the spicy green beans, i really enjoyed them! the mac & cheese was good too.  

Overall a good experience, wouldn't mind coming back if or when i am in the area.

Late night dinner on the roof!!...until it started raining. The food was delicious. I highly recommend the Mac n cheese! The staff was very friendly. Only 4 stars because we waited a copious amount of time for our check.

Updating and downgrading on stars. Years later and while they've improved by keeping sauces on the table, it seems even for this college town they just have a revolving door of below average staff. We went for my fiances birthday recently and won't be back - they messed up pretty much every aspect of his order (wrong salad dressing, forgot part of his entree, etc) and while we got some apologies we got some awkward and overdone excuses, too.

Visited with my wife Sunday evening. It's a shame the best part of the meal was the garlic mashed potatoes. The "brisket"looked and tasted more like pot roast. The pulled pork reminded me of coffee-crock pot pork. 
Also, I found it interesting the brisket was listed as being available gluten free (just remove the bread). Unfortunately, the cook is unaware that New Glarus Moon Man beer contains gluten.you can't braise a meat in a gluten based beer, then call it gluten free. This ignorance makes people sick.

I'll start this review out with a disclaimer: I'm just another Northerner, and I probably don't know much about BBQ.

My professional organization had an event hosted/catered here on the third floor.  But however they had it arranged for our number of people didn't work, so they put about 4 to 5 of us on the second floor away from the rest of our group, and they wouldn't bring any more chairs out or just one more table for the third floor.  

Next, they had three different types of BBQ available and then mac&cheese and cheese curds in the warmers.  The types of BBQ weren't labeled.  The mac&cheese wasn't very good, and needed more cheese.   It was too dry.  I didn't like any of the BBQ either.  It was not very flavorful, and the sauces weren't impressive.  I've cooked better in my slow cooker.  The cheese curds were probably the tastiest part of the meal, although the warmer didn't keep the temperature consistently warm across all curds.

The bartender was friendly and they had a fair amount of beer on tap, including some dark beers.  Might return, but for beer only.  Would not host another event here.

I really, really want to like Brickhouse BBQ due to its downtown location, nice and spacious interior, and fantastic-looking rooftop patio. 

When I visited, I ordered fried cheese curds--a Wisconsin specialty if there ever was one--and found them to be bland and extremely greasy, even for a cheesy item that is breaded and then dropped in a fryer. For the main course, I ordered a brisket sandwich, which was all-around disappointing. The meat, though relatively tender, had NO smoked or meaty flavor. On top of that, they added cheese and onion strings, both of which were also dripping with grease. Of course I understand that no BBQ place is a particularly healthy establishment, but this one just had puddles of grease on everything we tried (my husband had similar results with the pulled pork sandwich). Overall, this was just the kind of meal that not only made me feel gross after eating it, but that made me pretty sure a heart condition was on its way as well. 

Nonetheless, I can't promise I wouldn't return for one of Madison's only rooftop venues. Maybe to try some drinks?

Yum, is it ok to say yum five more time? Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum!!!!

Yeah, it was delicious.  I ordered the pulled pork dinner.  It came with a piece of Texas toast.  There was so much pork on my plate that it engulfed my toast.  I ordered the Roasted Veggies and Mac n Cheese as my sides.  I had two full meals from the leftovers I took home.  The portions are ridiculous.  

As for the taste?  Sensational.  The Mac n Cheese must have a cream cheese component.  It was so creamy and delicious.  The pulled pork was flavorful without being too salty or greasy.  

Why only four stars?  The space and the way the restaurant is laid out feels so cold.  I just can not get comfortable.  It felt very cold and isolated.  I was hoping to have a more homey feel.  Not to mention, I wish they would update their website.  

I love Brickhouse BBQ.  I find any excuse to go back.

Let me start with the pros: the beer selection was great and the ribs and onion ring appetizer was a perfect pre-dinner split. I'm not big on ribs and I really enjoyed how these fell off the bone. I also think the wait staff was great when it came to requests. My wife asked for horseradish sauce without knowing if they had any and we ended up getting some to dip our cheese curds in.

Now the cons: it took a while to get my drinks... Like a long while after my first one. There was also a lot of confusion and disappointment from patrons when they did not honor the pre-great taste specials that were posted online. 

I would probably go back and sit somewhere other than the bar to get some better attention and faster drinks.
Great food. Good ribs (nice bark!) Pulled Pork is always a safe bet. We'll be back. Beer and Bourbon lists are very complete. Gotsta Go!

They have a great selection of beer, and they should as they are apparently owned by their next door neighbor, Riley's.  Their beer is very reasonably priced and the server informed us that they're rotated out every so often.  It's a nice atmosphere inside: not too fancy, but not your local dive either where you're afraid to touch the tables in case they stick.  It seemed like a great place to chill and relax at.  I have no idea how they handle a big group, but I might like this for a place for hanging out with friends better than the Dane.  

The food was not very good.  I had the catfish sandwich, and it was a bit soggy.  I think there was just a bit too much sauce or oil or whatever.

WORST PULLED PORK, EVER!!  Didn't touch it...complained to manager...still for charged.

Decent collards, however.

The BBQ is good. I like their pulled pork dinner served on top of texas toast. The toast gets nice and soggy underneath the meat. They serve the food with a selection of BBQ sauces.

I never really realized they had so many taps. I'll have to go back to try. The last time I was here it was a couple of days before my 21st birthday. Taps do make a difference in my ratings...

I visited on a Saturday evening after a long walk last weekend.  

I thought the food and atmosphere were great.  The bartender on the 2nd floor was also outstanding with great food and beer recommendations.

I had a 1/3 rack of ribs....very good.  Not fall of the bone type of ribs, but very tasty.

The sides were simply amazing.  I got the mac and cheese and the green beans.  Best mac and cheese I have had in a long time....not too soppy or wet, but great flavor.  And the green beans were cooked perfectly and had fabulous flavor as well.

I would highly recommend and I will be back!!!

I had a Groupon for this place $15 for $30, best Groupon I have ever purchased. I had the Ribs along with the southern mac n cheese and coleslaw. All I can say was wow. Best Mac n cheese I have ever had!!!!! I eat at alot of BBQ joints and I can tell you that these ribs were terrific. 
The portion size was amazing. I had food for the next day's lunch! not to mention all the beers they had on tap. Great place to eat.
My wife had the pulled pork sandwich along with Veggies, she loved it as well.
Best BBQ ribs in Madison. I'll be heading back with or without a Groupon. 
Great first experience Brickhouse!

A 4.5 might be more appropriate, and that's only beause I like to save my 5 star rating for someplace really special... 

As people have said before, the beer selection is top-notch in the city, and they post the alcohol content so you know what you're getting into. The food is fancy-bar food, but A. what do you expect at a Barbeque, and B. that probably has something to do with my preferences. I ordered the pulled pork, and it was everything I want in a pulled pork. 

Atmosphere is quite nice. Madison doesn't have a ton of mid-level sit down places that aren't chain-restaurants, aren't dirty, and are affordable. It really fills a niche I didn't realize Madison was missing, so Kudos to you Mrs. Lee. 

For those of you unaware, Mrs. Lee is the Trump of Madison. She owns Church Key, Vinyard (liquor store below Key), Riley's, Samba, and now the Brickhouse. 

Anyhow, this place is worth a visit and if I still lived in Madison I would probably eventually have my own menu item. Far better than the bum shelter that previously occupied the building. Who would want to eat at a bum shelter?

New favorite place in Madison! The must-try Sunday $5 "Bloody Mary & Cow" was perfect for a Sunday Afternoon.... A delicious & unique spin on a classic! The Hawaiian Pork was seriously amazing, as was the mashed sweet potato casserole (just make sure they still have some!) The bartenders are super friendly & take good care of their customers. I highly recommend a visit!

Brickhouse has the worst service I've ever experienced by far. I've gone a couple times and the place has always been nearly empty. Even with only a few customers, the wait staff does not keep up. I'm not sure what they are doing, but we ordered beers and every time the waiter came back with the wrong one. There were only three choices for kill the keg on Thursdays. The $8 for unlimited beer was sadly wasted because the waiter only came by a couple time and for each order he returned 20 minutes later with the wrong order. I ended up drinking one beer because by the time he would come back I would most likely not get a beer for the next 20 min and I just do not have the time for that. 

On top of that the food was underwhelming. I do love the Cobb salad there, but the presentation was horrible. It comes with pulled pork, but I just got a slab of pork weighing down my salad unpulled. When we got our food we weren't given silverware. So we had to wait another 10 min for the server to come back with the rest of our food and ask for silverware.

Basically horrible service and underwhelming food.

Not too impressed. When I called to ask for the nearest parking garage the hostess didn't know and directed me to one almost a mile away when there was one around the corner. Second, the waitress did not know how much a salad was with my entree. She guessed. I ended up ordering the salad and I got my meal before my salad. When I asked to have it before she replied "we are really busy and couldn't get the salads before the meal". Ugh! The food was just OK. Setting and cleanliness was good but overall not impressed!

Menu selection was very good and service was great on a quiet downtown Saturday. I had a combo of ribs & brisket while hubby went with all brisket. Both of us found the meats to be tough and quite fatty which is not our preference. Sides were generally fine and presentation was good. Might be good if drinking heavily on a football Saturday but not if you're on the hunt for really good BBQ.

You would think due to the location and size of Brickhouse that it would be better but unfortunately in my two experiences there, I have not been impressed. 

Both times I have come to Brickhouse was for holiday work parties. We have rented out the 3rd floor space which is pretty cool. It has its own bar and a huge selection of beer which is the main reason for the 2 star rating. 

The biggest reason I rate them so low is due to the food. I have been to many BBQ spots around the midwest and Brickhouse lacks significantly. Granted both times it has been buffet style, but the food is bland and barely warm or even cold.

I think this is a fun restaurant! They've got a fabulous tap beer selection. I have dinned here a total of two times for dinner. 
I've liked the good each time. The first time I had their pulled pork on Texas toast with two sides. I choose Mac n cheese and cornbread, which was all good. Mathis most recent time I was here with a bachelorette party and I shared the pulled pork nachos that were made mainly with queso cheese and very tasty but some bites had more of a spice to them than others. They put a huge amount if sour cream right on top which I love with my nachos. I also had a cup of their chicken chili. I found it to be delicious! I only wish it was hotter when I was finally brought to our table.
Service as a whole I would rate 2/5 stars. It was extremely slow.

Yummy, but not what I think of when I think of a "BBQ" place. Definitely more upscale than your average barbecue joint. I actually felt a little weird picking up my ribs with my hands to eat them(When we are jonesin' for some Q, we usually go to Smoky Jon's, which is your "paper towels on the table, get down and messy" kind of place).

Anyhow, everything was decent. They have a two meat combo, which is nice when you want a little of this, and a little of that. I got the ribs and sausage. Ribs were really yummy, and the sausage while good, was unexpected--with a mustard sauce and lightly pickled peppers on top. Not your average style barbecue. The man had a pulled pork sandwich, juicy...but too smoked for my taste.

They serve all three of their sauces with the meal. Our fave was the molasses based sauce, hands down. The vinegar was okay, and the mustard "barbecue sauce" just seemed like tasty mustard. Eh. 

I chose the cheese grits, which were good...but fluffier in texture than I'm used to. The server recommended the roasted veggie pasta salad, which was average(not that it mattered, I was too full to eat it anyhow). 

Really torn between three and four stars. We'd like to check it out upstairs, so we'll be back!

The Pulled pork was bad.  Very fatty and the meat didn't looked like pulled pork.  Not impressed with the wait staff.  We heard two other tables complain about the pulled pork being fatty and gross. It didn't seem like there was a manager around to address these issues.  Will never go back.

If you want to eat real BBQ food go to Smoky Jon's on the east side of Madison.

I tried the lunch special for Restaurant Week.  The meal consisted of nachos topped with beef brisket - which were average; a pulled pork sandwich - which was bland and unseasoned; and a strawberry shortcake - which was tasty although tiny.  Three different barbecue sauces came with the meat, but they were also so weak as to be indistinguishable - even the "spicy" mustard sauce.   

The service, however, was top notch, although business was slow.

There are many better BBQ places in town.  I'll stick with those.

Awful. Cold Mac n Cheese, undercooked green beans, over blackened catfish and brisket I had to put so much sauce on to make it taste good. In addition, the bartender didn't know how to make an old fashioned. C'mon...

Recently went here. They had deals on groupon and I've been here a couple times. Even though the reviews are a mixed bag, I really thought my experience was great. The environment was very nice. You have the option to sit inside, upper deck, or back patio. I ordered the two meat combo and chose 1/3 ribs, brisket, Mac , and sweet potato fries. Didn't really like the fries, but everything else was wonderful. They have specials every day and this info is posted on the front. It's a great place to eat during the summer time.other times can be very busy.

I have yet to find a barbeque restaurant that I have been blown away by, and my search continues. I ordered the Dragon's Milk beer with the pulled pork with double side of sweet potato fries. My favorite part of my meal was probably stealing my boyfriend's side of spicy beans. The barbeque sauces provided were alright but forgettable, and the pork was moist. But as I said, the whole meal didn't impress me; it tasted like a meal I could buy at any restaurant that serves anything barbeque.

The part of the meal that upset me the most was the sweet potato fries; sweet potatoes (more-so sweet potato fries) are one of my favorite foods in the world. I will always get it no matter where I am. However, the sweet potato fries here were slightly cold, stale, and mushy (and I never believed that combination could exist). 

Menu had a variety of items, and the beer menu was eclectic. The environment was friendly, open, and large, and the server was nice and attentive.

Overall, the barbeque was delicious but forgettable. I would be willing to go again, but only after I forget the abominable sweet potato fries.

I went last night with a friend--and it was just a bad idea.

The ribs, which are normally pretty solid were burnt to a crisp, bland, and dry. I'm not a fan of well done meat, especially for barbeque because you can get the nice coat without destroying the inside meat.

Additionally, our waitress was, like many other posters mentioned, wasn't very attentive. It took her 20 minutes to figure out that we needed our bill, and it's not like the place was super busy. When we came in originally too, the hostess was busy talking to a friend until a waitress pointed out we were waiting.

It seems every time I come here, this place just gets more bland and less tasty to me. I think I'm going to avoid coming here for awhile.

Very mixed experiences from visit to visit.  The last visit was not good...we used the Groupon and had the following issues.  Server wasn't that engaged, wrong entree was brought out, and the entrees were brought out before we got half way through the appetizer.  On the plus side, beer selection is outstanding, mac and cheese is great, and typically the food is really good.

There really wasn't anything bad about Brickhouse - it was just okay. I wasn't very hungry when I got there, so that may have contributed to my lack of "wooooo this is great!" feelings.

I will say, though, the service was quick, attentive, and accurate (we had a group of 8), and the classic burger was pretty good. The fries that came with it were especially tasty - really nicely seasoned with some interesting flavors in there.

Even with the lack of high points, I'll probably try Brickhouse again; this time when I'm hungrier.

I loved this place until I met Gretchen. We came in for my best friend's birthday night and Gretchen was incredibly rude, condescending, and unprofessional. I asked for her last name and she responded "give me your last name" as if we were in middle school dissing each other. I've worked in the service industry for over 5 years now and have never seen my fellow coworkers treat any guest this way. I myself have worked in a similar "college" environment as Gretchen does and I was able to professionally deal with all guests at all times. We asked to see the manager and she said that she was the manager, which made the situation only more disappointing. I've never seen a manager deal with a situation so unprofessionally. Whenever my family comes to visit Madison from out of state, I always brought them to this establishment. Never again. We were a group of over 6 people, so she explained that we could not split a check all together. We completely understood, so we asked to sit at two separate tables. She said that because we know each other, that's not possible. She then threatened us by saying "maybe you can go to Hopcat to be served." Never in all my years have I been threatened by a manager. Then Gretchen proceeded to say that we were are unhappy, we should leave a Yelp review about. The servers around Gretchen were so uncomfortable with Gretchen's comments and condescending tone that they left the area to seek relief. I used to love this place, but have never felt so disrespected by any manager. We were polite and understanding of her policies, but she refused to return this respect. I'd also like to point out that the restaurant was almost empty on the first floor, so lack of space or it being a busy night was not a factor. I wish I could give less than 1 star.

Wish i could give less than one star. We went in with a large group and were they wouldn't seat us, even if we broke into smaller groups. There were multiple empty tables open that we could see, and the manager very rudely told us we couldn't eat there, period, because we had too many people. What kind of a restaurant turns away customers! Awful. Will not be going back.

I am torn on this one. I didn't really care for my meal, but there wasn't really anything bad about it.

I had wanted to order the brisket sandwich, but Brickhouse BBQ opts for slicing over pulling. I'm not a big meat person, but when I do eat it, I don't want to see any pink. Not wanting to have to deal with a pile of possibly not-cooked-enough-for-me brisket, I opted for the chicken sandwich. 

The chicken breast was huge, an inch thick in some places. It was almost too much. Unfortunately, there was a spongy bit (fat? other weird things I don't really want to think about?), so that was kind of gross. There was a lot of char, which I'm not a fan of, but once again - that's a matter of personal preference, not really anything that Brickhouse did wrong. I would, however, recommend that they put the monster of a sandwich on something stronger than white toast - I had to eat my sandwich with a knife and fork because the sauce and other toppings rendered the bread useless. 

Several people at the table chose the pulled pork sandwich and were really happy with it; the people who chose salads seemed ambivalent.  The fries were pretty good, but of the battered variety - I prefer my spuds simple. 

Brickhouse has a large selection of beers & other drinks, but beware of the price. My friend ordered a margarita rocks from the bar while waiting for the rest of our party to arrive and it ended up being $7.50. In Madison, that's pretty pricey, especially for a restaurant bar during what is normally considered happy hour.
Great beer selection- tons of craft stuff on tap. Good is solid, waitstaff is decent. Check it out

This is the fourth time I've been to this restaurant, and it was great as always.  The beer list is extensive, with 40 beers to choose from, not to mention the great bbq.  The lovely young ladies that were serving the customers were extremely friendly and attentive.  I'll be back next time I'm in town!

Brickhouse has been on my list to try for several months and after finally getting the opportunity it was not hit.  The sides, mac-n-cheese and greens, were better than the meat.  The ham was dry and ribs tasted like they have been warmed over for the past couple of days. Was definitely hoping for better.

I was very disappointed in my meal. The brisket tastes old and had an off taste to it. The pit beans tasted like just chili with extra beans in it. My buddy had same opinion on meal. I will say had good atmosphere and the service was good but if they continue to serve sub part food won't be there for long. I hope they get it together.

Their tap beer selection was outstanding, unfortunately that's about the only positive thing I can say.  Their BBQ sauce (which most BBQ lovers know can make or break your restaurant) was extremely watered-down, service was average at best and their food was just OK overall.  It seems like they're trying to go gourmet with BBQ, which in my opinion isn't working for them.  Smoky Jon's is still the only place you can get "real" BBQ in Madison.

I didn't try the "authentic" BBQ stuff like ribs but I did have a chicken sandwich there and I found it it really delicious.  The interior is lovely, the beers are nicely priced, and our waiter was attentive and polite.  And considering the restaurant is supposed to be upscale, the price for the food was not bad.
Pretty good BBQ but slow service. Maybe becauce it was Monday night? I don't know... I have to mention wide selection of beer and free wi-fi.

Heaping brisket sandwich with full on beefy flavor and not fatty. The only gripe I had was that the bread was a little much and one almost needs an unhindgable jaw to get a propper bite. Good mac and cheese and it was a rather large "side." The mustard based sauce is something you don't find very much around these parts and I loved it. The habanero peach BBQ sauce was sweet and had a little kick and went very well with the pulled BBQ. Good experience and I will continue to keep coming back.

I made the mistake of looking over the reviews before starting to write my own.  A lot of negative reviews...making me wonder if my awesome meal a little while ago was real or just a dream...

Well if it was a dream I am going to go back for another dream as soon as I can!  I didn't want a heavy beefy meal so I went with the grilled chicken sandwich with bacon, cheddar, tomatoes, carmalized onions, spicy mayo, and bbq sauce.  Yes it was quite wet but it was delicious.  The bacon was not your run-of--the-mill oscar mayer.  It was thick and tasty yet cooked to crispy perfection.  The fries were great.  The three dipping sauces were all good with a special mention of the mustard based bbq sauce.  Who would have thought that would have been so tasty!

She had the appetizer portion of the ribs and we both agreed that they were the tastiest ribs either of us has ever had.  My grandfather used to smoke ribs for hours and Brickhouse's were right up there with his.

Beer selection was impressive.  Our server was fast and friendly.  The restaurant itself is modern yet warm...basically a beautiful setting for a wonderful meal.  We will go back.

Everything I've tried here is really good. The ribs, mac and cheese and mashed potatoes are all excellent. I wasn't expecting great cheese curds from a BBQ joint but they were delicious (not overly battered, well flavored). Service has always been good and the waitstaff is really nice.

I'm not sure you can consider this actual BBQ. It is more like cooked meat with BBQ sauce on it. The brisket was terrible. No crust on it whatsoever, not tender, and absolutely no flavor. The BBQ sauce didn't even help it out because it also tasted like it came from a generic bucket marked "BBQ sauce". I gave most of it to my dog who left some over as well. The pulled pork was edible but also tastes like the pulled pork you get from Costco, if not worse, and definitely overpriced. The cornbread also tasted like it came from a prepackaged can. Tasteless and kinda dry. Absolutely a disappointing attempt at BBQ. For BBQ lovers who know what is what, save your money and avoid this place.

BBQ is the focus of a BBQ joint. At $20/plate, I hoped to see some meat. Servings are true serving sizes. Had the two meat platter, was truly 4 ounces total. Brisket was dry and chewy. Pulled pork was dry. Brisket comes out thinly sliced and all meat is on top of the Texas toast leaving it soggy. I concur with other reviews that refer to BBQ from the south. This is no gem.

Met a couple of people here for drinks and food.  The bbq is okay, but not great.  It is really greasy, and not in a good way. I don't know where all that grease is coming from! But it hits the spot after a few beers.  They do have a GREAT beer selection and a beautiful rooftop to sit on, so I would definitely go back.

We have been coming to Brickhouse every Tuesday since they started trivia around a year ago. It was great then. It has steadily grown in popularity since and the management has done nothing to accommodate the large number of people every week. Some weeks there will be one server and one bartender for the entire packed restaurant. They have an entire upstairs that they don't even utilize. 
Despite these issues, the food is fairly good and the bartender and most of the servers are great. The exception is the purple haired server who is consistently very rude and condescending to everyone. She is concerned about the fire code which is fine, but her complete lack of hospitality is the issue here. After several members of my team were yelled at this week we will no longer be returning. 
It's a shame, there are a lot of great things about Brickhouse. I hope they can work on accommodating the trivia goers, and regular patrons on Tuesdays and find more servers who know what customer service is.

Not sure why this place doesn't have very good reviews - I've lived in Texas my whole life and this is not bad BBQ. Much better than That BBQ Joint and Dave's on Park.

The location is super convenient, the service was good, and the ambience is pretty neat. The place is also actually a relatively 'nice' sit down restaurant, unlike people may think based on the exterior. It's pretty huge on the inside! They also have trivia on Tuesdays which is super fun.

Overall, I got their brisket plate and it was delicious! Good portions and good sides. The brisket didn't blow me away but it was by no means bad. Check this place out if you've been looking for above average bbq!

I've tried this place a couple of times over the years, and have always been disappointed. I thought I'd give it another try, and was again disappointed. The ribs were thin and had little meat. What meat was to be found between the bones was stringy and over cooked. The sides are fine, and they have a large beer selection, but that doesn't compensate for the poor quality meat. There are much better places in Madison for BBQ.

If I were to recommend Brickhouse, I would suggest just going there for beers and appetizers. They have a very good beer selection. They also have a good rooftop patio for a nice day.

In terms of the food, it wasn't great for me. I got the ribs and they were cooked well, but the cut of meat that they gave me was incredibly fatty, which was gross. I also got corn on the cob as a side and they brought me butter, but no salt or pepper, which I found odd. Our friends got their smoked pulled pork and it was again good, but nothing special. We make better smoked pork on our smoker at home, it has much more flavor.

Last, we went with our kids and even though this place is downtown and may not advertise itself as "kid friendly", they could've done a better job. They took WAY to long to get us our check when the kids were obviously getting antsy, and it wasn't even that busy. Come to think of it, it took a longer than avg time to get our drinks as well.

We went the other night and while the decor and ambiance is amazing and so beautifully done, I was left wishing the food had been as great. 

I like how they keep unique pint glasses on each table and that the tables are simple and neat.  It wasn't very busy when we went and we were seated right away and given drinks within 5 minutes.  Our server was incredibly nice and did a great job.

I had the pulled pork sandwich with a side of the mac and cheese and my bf had the brisket sandwich.  His was awesome, with really great flavors.  Mine was just alright and I've definitely had better at a lower price, the mac and cheese however was really good.  Unfortunately my sandwich had an unwelcome hair in it and without me even saying anything, the waitress noticed my face, took it away, comped it and apologized.  Her handling of the situation was perfect and I do understand that accidents happen everywhere.  It certainly won't hinder me from trying it again.

The service was quick and friendly and it was certainly nice to have a variety of different BBQ sauces to add to the food.  Everyone seemed efficient and friendly, and again I can't say enough how beautifully decorated it was.

I can't wait to see what the huge outdoor patio is like as the weather gets nicer!

I'm a HUGE fan of BBQ, so let's just get it out of the way now and admit that the likelihood of any restaurant in the Midwest truly competing with the best BBQ has to offer is slim to none.  No offense, and I'm not even from BBQ country.

1)  The BEER selection is insanely awesome.  I would return here solely to drink beer because they have so many great options (many of which are local!)

2)  The food.  Ok, obvious choice here, but let me elaborate.  First, the portions are pretty insane.  I had the Brisket Sandwich, and while I did finish the plate I kind of regretted doing it.  Luckily, I had been starving before I walked in to try this place.  The brisket itself was well done, it was a great chunk of meat size-wise (run with that however you want), and it reminded me of good BBQ.  The sauces are, to me anyway, obviously homemade (and I mean that in a bad way).  The smokey, typical, BBQ sauce is delicious.  Well done there.  The vinegar sauce isn't too bad, but I think that vinegar BBQ fans will be disappointed.  The mustard was Ter-ri-ble.  It tastes like mustard and lacks the nuance and layered flavors that real mustard-based BBQ sauces have.  Kudos for trying though.  I actually found that I liked mixing the vinegar with the smokey-molasses, but they should really only give people the latter.  Thank god they gave me all three choices, which was a nice touch.  If I had been forced to use the mustard, I would have walked out.  The fries were some of the best I remember eating.  Wow.  Keep doing what you're doing there.

As far as the atmosphere, that's a great word to describe a place that seems kind of small until you realize that there are three floors.  Each floor has its bar as well (great planning!).  Nothing else is too special about it other than the fact that there is actually brick in The Brickhouse.  

The service was awesome.  I sat at the bar and Clayton served me.  We talked about football and a few other topics over the course of lunch.  Good conversation, good service, and he even offered to give me a tour of the place when I told him that I had been curious about it for a while before finally showing up to try it out.

Price is good.  When your food arrives, you know that you probably haven't paid enough for the portion you get.  This is likely covered up in the cost of whatever meat they're using.  I don't know where they source it, but BBQ is kind of about making great meat out of anything.   So, while I don't really care, it would be cool if they had a local option with their food like they have with their beer.

I'll be back.

UPDATE: How could I forget to mention that they have somewhere around 40-50 types of Bourbon.  I love Bourbon.  If you love it too, you'll find this place to be very enjoyable.

Went to Brickhouse with two buddies for the first time in about a year, and all three of our meals were horrible.  The ribs and the brisket were way over cooked and tough.  Shocking how bad it was.  The corn bread was totally and entirely dry, just paln bad.  I had eaten here in the past and the sausage was good, so I was very disappointed, but the food cannot lie.  Luckily, the Miller Lite was on special for $2 a pint and the waitress was really friendly and did her best.

We visited Brickhouse twice while in Madison on 7/11/14 and the following night.  The first day was late afternoon before the dinner rush so it was obviously a slow time.  Excellent meals both visits and sampled a variety of items.  Fantastic BBQ and I especially recommend the ribs.  Top notch beer selection also for the craft beer lovers out there.  Tons of food and you won't leave hungry that's for sure.

One note about our second visit on Saturday night about 8:30.  We were in town for a high school world archery tournament and had a party of close to 30.  We originally wanted to hook-up at a different restaurant downtown but our first choice was a smaller place with limited seating, and we were looking at obviously a very long wait.  Because of our great experience the previous day, I placed a call to Brickhouse and explained the situation with our large group.  Expecting perhaps to be laughed at or a sarcastic comment about seating such a large group during a prime time, I was surprised how accommodating the staff was, especially when I explained that in no way were we looking to have everyone sit together.  They could break us up as necessary, whatever worked best for seating on their end.  The person on the phone (can't remember her name) said no problem come on over.

We walked over and they ended up re-arranging tables on the 2nd floor to seat about 20 and the rest were split into two tables.  The point is, many places would make the customer realize what a pain the butt it is to make these type of accommodations, but the staff at Firehouse went above & beyond.  Thanks for making the visit so enjoyable both times, and I'll be sure to stop back the next time we're in town.

They didn't have the one beer I was looking for (Pumpking). 
I was told if I write a review solely based on that... I'm "that yelper."
So in addition to them not having the beer that I went there for, they also serve sauce-less wings in this sort of DIY format that is nowhere near getting a thoroughly dredged and sauced up wing that leaves you wishing you had more napkins. I'll try 'em out again and explore more of the menu and hope they have Pumpking next time on draft.

This place is like ---this close--- to being awesome. I can't say anything bad about the food----but it fell short in most other areas. We went there because it was voted "best rooftop patio"...but the roof was closed for a private event. Obviously a bummer. They offered us a spot on the back patio, which was a beautiful space----but we were seated under some type of giant ventilation fan that I'm pretty sure was pumping out greasy kitchen air. Pretty unappetizing. Fortunately the entire patio was open (so not sure why we were given that seat) so we moved ourselves to something more scenic. Looking around it was obvious that the patio needed a good 30 minutes of cleaning and tidying up-----many of the tables looked dusty.....cobwebs between the railings. Its unfortunate because like I said...it's a beautiful space. There's also a nice area for playing bags---but their bag set was really sad (some saggy plastic thing sponsored by miller, sigh). It would take very little effort to make the atmosphere back there go from a 3 to a 5. 

The service was also kind of disappointing. Our server failed to bring plates, silverware or napkins with our appetizer until asked, and then delivered our main dish (which were sharing) and didn't return with new plates until we had already split it up on our appetizer plates. 

Overall I'm not in a hurry to go back----but the Brickhouse Mac N Cheese was probably good enough for me to return eventually.

We were staying at Hampton Inn and had Brickhouse deliver, so i can't talk about decor or service. The food was great. We ordered the two meat entree with brisket and smoked turkey. (I do wish the tri tip was an option.) The brisket was tender, but not quite as flavorful as I'd hoped, but the turkey was fantastic! The cornbread and the smashed red potatoes were also uncommonly good. The chicken wings were serviceable, but I was a little disjointed by the duck legs which didn't really taste like anything without the dipping sauce. The portions were a good size and the price was right.

When you order barbeque at this place they give you three different sauces, and tell you about each one. I wouldn't bother listening though, since they are sweet, extra sweet, and grossly sweet.

If you want your food to taste like it was made in a pixi sticks factory go here. Otherwise, I'd advise sticking to the beer. You can also expect terrible service.

Under new management, and a VERY small menu. After walking downtown looking for a place to eat, every place was packed or only accepting reservations due to college graduation. We went on a Friday night and the place had 3 people in it. On a Friday UW GRADUATION night. Menu was disappointing to say the least, especially having been here in the past and loved the food. This place will be lucky to last another 2 months at the rate they are going.

It's...ok at best. 

Maybe I've been ruined by having barbecue in real barbecue cities like Memphis and St. Louis. But just because this is Madison doesn't mean you can't make good barbecue here too. Brickhouse doesn't quite get there for me. 

Think of it as a place with good beer selection and halfway decent BBQ, and you're less likely to be disappointed. But this is far from a transcendental BBQ experience.

Tried this place during restaurant week 2012. I'm a huge fan of BBQ and Brickhouse had never come across my radar before so I was eager to check it out. They served the chicken skewer app with three different BBQ sauces (yay!) follwed by a rack of ribs with a side of mac & cheese. The mac was delicious, creamy, with bread crumb topping. There was peach cobbler for dessert but I only got one bite down because I was so full (having a stout beer helped with that). Finding parking and walking there is a hassle if you don't live downtown, I will try it again if I'm in the mood for navigating there.

I had come to Brickhouse BBQ on a couple of occasions thanks to Groupon and I found that given their prices they were mediocre.

On one occasion I had BBQ brisket and mac and cheese. The mac and cheese there is very good (but that's hard to mess up) but the brisket was drier than I expected it to be. On a later visit I decided I'd go with the chicken and unfortunately encountered the same thing-- the chicken was dry. 

The sauce selections were alright, but nothing that really made me want to use only that particular sauce.

After a couple of attempts my wife and I decided not to come back at least until there is evidence of a change in direction for the food quality.
Great service and very good food.  The meat was very tender and the smash garlic potatoes were awesome!

We had dinner at Brickhouse when we were visiting family in Madison. Our party of 8 was seated at a large table on the second floor. Nice ambiance, very spacious, not too noisy. 

Our table ordered a variety of dishes: hush puppies, vegetable sandwich, sausage sandwich, Brickhouse ribs, two meat combos. Everything was huge! I was thrilled with my vegetable sandwich. Gigantic portabella mushrooms! Generous side of fries. $7.99. This was 2 meals for me. 

Only 1 person at our table wasn't happy with their meal because the ribs and roasted chicken were too dry. Way too dry. Like it's been sitting there under a heat lamp for hours and hours. 

P.S. The 3 different BBQ sauces are delicious!

Not sure why every time we visit this place it's dead. We always eat at the bar and have great service from the bartender. $5 bloody Mary's on Sunday's with the choice of any chaser. Good good at reasonable price.

Was not happy with there Thursday evening kill the keg. The staff was seemed like they wanted us to leave so they could close but this was still very early in the evening. Also the one beer option in the keg was flat.

Was there this past weekend and had a GREAT time!!  Staff was fantastic, food was good, and the brews were very,very good. Our son is a student at the UW and I plan to spend time at this place whenever we visit. Loved our time there.

The waiter was very unpleasant. He took his time taking our order. We finally got our food close to an hour later. Everything was cold and unappetizing. We went on a Sunday afternoon. They only had a handful of customers. There's no excuse for the rude service and long wait. Save your money and time. I recommend trying anywhere else!

A visit in 2016 proved that Brickhouse BBQ has some failings, although they do maintain a good beer program.  Upon entering the 2 story building (and a rooftop patio), I noticed that our booth had a large rip in the seat.  In addition, the booth's seat back was directly connected to the other person's bench behind you, so you both parties could feel the seat backs moving around. Distracting.

The servers were pleasant and efficient.  Each entree comes with 2 sides and a cornbread, which is more than generous, and the sides don't include an upcharge for stuff like mac and cheese or sweet potato fries instead of potato fries.  I ordered the beef brisket, mac and cheese, and fries.  Our food came out quickly, but it was disappointing. The brisket had no smoke ring and the fries were clearly not fresh--they were warm instead of piping hot. The mac&cheese was fine, although it had a bit more of a butter taste than super cheesy. The cornbread is of a sweeter northern style.  The Hawaiian pork is really overly sweet.  At the table, you have 3 BBQ sauces, a regular (relatively sweet), a mango something, and a sriracha something. Out of these, the sriracha is the best.

Onto the positive--service was good, and the beer list and patio.  I did not visit the patio, but the view was very nice when I went a few years ago. In addition to a large beer list, they had quite a few good beers on special for $3 a pint.

I won't be returning for food. I can see it being an option for beer, especially on the patio.

Visit Madison often to visit our daughter who is a student at the UW.  Great town for foodies due to the high quality of the restaurants and various ethnic food options.   Last week we stopped by the Brickhouse for the first time.  Had a barbecue pork sandwich, which was amazing, while my wife had the Korean BBQ meal.   Out waitress was friendly and attentive,  and the manager was engaged with his customers.  Overall it was an excellent experience.   Planning to return often.

good food but not your idea of a typical smokehouse. Not in St.Louis so i can't say i was disappointed at the quality of their BBQ either, but not the best i've ever had. Nice place to sit and enjoy a quiet conversation in beautiful space looking out onto the busy street if you're not looking for a knock your socks off BBQ experience.

The worst part about this place is knowing that you're too old to not need a nap before you try to go out afterward.  Great portions for the money.  I'm a big fan of meat, and this place does it right.  The chicken isn't dry, and the ribs are tender without being messy.  You also get a choice of two sides with a dinner, which really means you only need to decide on one because, good God, if you don't already have the mac 'n cheese penciled in...good luck in life.

Very accomodating for large groups.  A positively astounding beer selection.
They've got Toppling Goliath on top, if you've got a craving for a solid IPA.

Aye, Brickhouse has really let me down a few times, which is unfortunate because they host some fun events/specials and I love their space. 

Our most recent visit was spoiled with mediocre food and bad drinks. 

We opted to sit on the rooftop (it's really beautiful up there, but it always seems to be empty/not utilized). There was a bartender up there who took our drink order, but she let us know that their tap system upstairs doesn't work very well because it's on the third floor. After ordering one beer, my boyfriend commented that it was quite flat, and she shrugged it off and said many of the taps are flat up there. After selecting one of the few she recommended as being a safe bet, we ordered food and sat down. 

I got the black bean burger, which came out charred and crispy. For my side, I chose coleslaw, which was actually decent. My boyfriend got the shrimp and polenta, which was listed under the entrees section, but does not come with a side (the waitress said it was a misprint?). 

I've been here multiple times and it always seems to be wacky. They just can't seem to serve good food and pair it with good service. Their space is massive and maintained well, so it's a shame they can't capitalize on it.
Rating is for the beer selection...top notch.  Cool building, nice location.  Will be back for the Q...

My first experience at Brickhouse BBQ was to attend a birthday party hosted in the third floor room. I was really impressed with the space and made a mental note to remember it for future events due to its lovely aesthetics and spacious room. The food served was great and memorable. After this when I saw a groupon available I knew I had to buy it. We came early on Monday night and it felt a little awkward being the only people in such a large space, but within 15 minutes the place started filling up. Prior to ordering I alerted our server (though I think he was actually the bartender or manager) that we would be using the groupon. 

During our meal I overheard another server inform his table that there were menu restrictions with the groupon, knowing we ordered two basic/ not the most expensive entrees I thought we were fine, but was surprised to receive our check charging for one of the two entrees ordered. Upon asking our server he explained the menu restrictions, after expressing frustrations with not being alerted as others were to the limited menu he promptly and sincerely apologized and gave us a discount on the remaining bill. I was really pleased with both the food and our service, especially the calm way which the confusion was handled. The misunderstanding was not a blemish on the experience at all due to the great customer service we received. 

Giving it four out of five stars simply because I have one BBQ restaurant in Madison that based on food alone, I prefer over Brickhouse.

Far too expensive for mediocre barbecue.

I stopped by this place before the state basketball championships because a friend had a 2 for 1 coupon he and his brother were going to use. Talk about an unfunded mandate!

My other friend and I had to pay full price, and this is one of the few times I have had this kind of sticker shock for a meal. We ordered a drink apiece, a meal, and water, and it came to about $40 per person. The barbecue itself was similar to Smoky Jon's (vinegar based) at about twice the price. Since I prefer molasses based barbecue or dry rub, I'll not be eating here again.

The other strike against Brickhouse was that the service was terrible the time I went here. Our waitress was not very good, but I could tell she was par for the course in watching other tables and how they were served.

If I want barbecue near downtown Madison, I'll go to Famous Dave's or Fat Jack's instead.

Disappointing. Brisket sandwich was dry, and I don't understand why filling it with greasy onion rings is supposed to be a good thing. Sauces, which I had to ask for, were less than exciting. Parking is difficult. Probably won't be back, unfortunately.
Great brisket sandwiches.  Great beer and whiskey selection.

They've gotten a lot better since they first opened! The view is wonderful on the patio in the summer. Everything is delicious. We came on new year's eve and used a groupon. The sever was attentive and prompt. My boyfriend loved the nachos with brisket.

Their ribs are tender, fall-off-the-bone deliciousness. They have three good house sauces from which to choose. I just wish that they had a spicy sauce as an option. The best Bloody Mary that I've had in years. Fun and relaxed environment. I'm sure that I'll come back for more. I highly recommend this place.

No complaints here.  The place is beautiful!   The  food is great with huge portions.  The beer is cold.  There were three of us that went and we had the pulled pork dinner, 1/2 rack of ribs and the brisket sandwich.  For sides we sampled fries, spicy green beans and cheese grits.  The spicy green beans were my least favorite.  I did not find them spicy and they were not cooked long enough for me.  Cheese grits were really good and so are the fries.  They bring you a sample of sauces - house, vinegar and a mustard one.  They were all good, but my favorite was the house.  Our service was good, and the setting is really nice.  We were too full for dessert, but that looked good too!
The brisket sandwich was tender, juicy, delicious. Chicken sandwich not quite as good, but tasty anyway. Great selection of tap beers, worth a visit.

This place lacked class from the initial walk-in. After 50+minutes of waiting for a table to seat out group of 8, it ONLY took 20 minutes to take our order. Once ordered, it only took OVER an hour and 15 minutes to get the actual food. The food was maybe average at best. Don't waste your time here. Stick to the Great Dane or Walmart if you want service. This place lacks class and service.
